pro.ProductName: MQTT IoT Edge Gateway - Products - KEB
body_html:
Router

MQTT IoT Edge Gateway

KEB’s Edge Gateway connects local industrial controllers to the cloud. The gateway uses a lightweight MQTT protocol to push tag data to common cloud platforms like Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud.

Catalog Manual
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

Push local PLC data to the cloud with the lightweight MQTT protocol.

The Edge Router is designed for tough industrial applications and connects to nearly every PLC platform.

The Edge Gateway is a DIN Rail mount, powered with 24VDC, and carries UL and CE marks.

The router supports over 40 communication drivers including EtherNet/IP, Profinet, OPC, Modbus TCP, and EtherCAT.

An Industrial Cellular Router version is available for remote and mobile applications. It works on 4G global GSM networks and a variety of antenna types are possible.

Ideal applications include Water/Wastewater, SCADA, Renewable Energy, and Discrete Automation.

Tech Specs

Electrical

• CPU Processor – ARM Cortex A8 processor Freescale i.MC535 1 GHz
• Microsoft Windows Embedded Compact 7
• 512 MB RAM
• 256 MB read-only NAND-flash (O.S. and Runtime)
• Between 2-4GB depending on model

Mechanical

DIN Rail Mount (35mm)

Certifications

  • CE
  • cULus LISTED

Interfaces

  • • WAN – Ethernet 10/100 Mbps (RJ45)
  • • LAN – Ethernet 100 Mbps (RJ45)
  • • USB – 1 x USB 2.0
  • • Serial – 1 x RS-232/422/485 (DB15M) optoisolated
  • • 1 x SIM Card (mini) socket push-push type (available in GSM Cellular model)
  • • 1 x SMA plug (various additional antenna options) (available in GSM Cellular model)

Environment

  • Operating temperature: 0 … +59 °C
  • Storage temperature: -20 … +60 °C
  • Relative humidity: 5 … 95 %, without condensation
  • IP20

Tech Specs

• Cellular network
• Standard 2G/3G/3G+/4G EDGE/HSPA quadriband up to 5.76 Mbps upload/14.4 Mbps download
• SMAStecker auxiliary diversity antenna
• SIM card mini socket push-push type

Memory
• 2 GB eMMC solid state drive
• 4 GB eMMC solid state drive

Software
• COMBIVIS connect
• COMBIVIS HMI

MQTT
An optional MQTT push agent is available for pushing data to IoT Cloud platforms like AWS, Microsoft Azure, etc.

Options

• Cellular network
• Standard 2G/3G/3G+/4G EDGE/HSPA quadriband up to 5.76 Mbps upload/14.4 Mbps download
• SMAStecker auxiliary diversity antenna
• SIM card mini socket push-push type

Memory
• 2 GB eMMC solid state drive
• 4 GB eMMC solid state drive

Software
• COMBIVIS connect
• COMBIVIS HMI

MQTT
An optional MQTT push agent is available for pushing data to IoT Cloud platforms like AWS, Microsoft Azure, etc.

Related

Applications and How-Tos

How to Send Machine Data to Microsoft Azure with KEB’s Cloud Router

Colin Zauner | November 2nd, 2020
Applications and How-Tos

Pushing Tag Data from Allen Bradley PLC to AWS Cloud

Jonathan Bullick | November 5th, 2019

Application of NAT rules with the C6 Router

Colin Zauner | October 29th, 2018
Applications and How-Tos

Remote Access to Allen Bradley PLCs

Colin Zauner | November 7th, 2016

How Do MQTT IoT Routers Work?

What is an MQTT IoT Router?

An MQTT IoT router connects various IoT devices for monitoring and data management. Think of it as a central hub for IoT sensors and devices, connecting these systems and routing any data they collect to a shared cloud platform.

An IoT router supports data communication between devices on the network, allowing commands to be sent from cloud-based applications to various IoT devices. The router acts as a translator for inter-device communication, so information flows seamlessly from the device to the cloud and vice versa.

An MQTT gateway (or router) uses a special data protocol to collect and send device information to the cloud called Message Queuing Telemetry Transport (MQTT). This reliable machine-to-machine network protocol works especially well for connecting devices in remote locations with scarce network bandwidth.

An IoT router can also be augmented with cellular capabilities for remote and mobile applications. For example, KEB’s Edge Gateway offers an industrial cellular router version for use with global GSM networks worldwide, providing a more robust and versatile connectivity solution.

MQTT Gateway Advantages

MQTT offers many advantages over other common data protocols for IoT (such as CoAP or DDS), including scalability. The MQTT gateway uses a simple publish/subscribe model that puts minimal bandwidth burden on the network. As such, it can be scaled up across more devices into larger networks while maintaining performance and power efficiency.

Reliability is another major benefit of MQTT gateway technology. As a lightweight network protocol, MQTT is uniquely suitable for connecting devices in remote locations. Its small code footprint and bandwidth requirements enable dependable connections, even across IoT devices with resource limitations.

Moreover, MQTT is a highly secure protocol for transferring data between devices and the cloud. MQTT servers can authenticate clients using passwords, an SSL protocol, or a combination of both to ensure safe, secure data management.

Industrial Applications for MQTT IoT Routers

Thanks to their robust flexibility and limited resource draw, MQTT IoT routers can support many industrial applications. KEB’s Edge Router can operate in temperatures of 0 to 50 C and includes a heavy-duty DIN rail mount for secure mounting even in challenging work environments.

Renewable energy sectors, such as wind power, leverage the KEB IoT router to monitor and maintain wind turbines in the field. This gateway system gathers data from various sensors within the wind farm turbines, measuring energy output, stresses, temperatures, and even shaft vibration and speed to ensure safe, 24/7 operation.

SCADA (supervisory control and data acquisition) is a natural fit for the KEB IoT router, empowering users to gather equipment data in real-time from remote locations via sensors. These performance insights help organizations manage equipment and workflow conditions, reduce costs and downtime through predictive maintenance, and more.

Other ideal uses for the KEB IoT router include Discrete Automation and water/wastewater applications. This router enables remote monitoring of wastewater operations using on-site PLC. Furthermore, the Edge Gateway supports both set-up and troubleshooting of new equipment and offers cellular connectivity to support machines in remote locations. An HMI version of the router can be used to log and view important metrics remotely, including water levels, temps, and pH values.

body_html:
Servo Drives & VFDs

COMBIVERT F5 Inverter

The F5 COMBIVERT drive is designed to handle the most difficult applications worldwide and is available up to 1,200 Hp. The F5 platform is extremely flexible and offers configurable safety options, heatsinks, encoder interfaces, and communication ports.

Catalog Manuals Software
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

The COMBIVERT F5 control card is available in three different performance/feature levels to match application requirements: Basic, Compact, and Application

Available in 230, 480, and 690 VAC classes through 1,200 Hp.

Modular communication operator concept for ultimate flexibility – Supports EtherNet/IP, ProfiNet, Modbus, EtherCAT, Powerlink, DeviceNet, CAN, Sercos, and Interbus.

High Speed outputs – Up to 2000Hz output for running high speed, high-frequency motors

F5 encoders cards are dual-channel with different input and output options. Different versions are available to support different formats, including Incremental TTL/HTL, Resolver, BiSS, EnDAT, and Hiperface.

The F5 VFD can run with carrier frequencies up to 16kHz and automatically derates if needed.

Tech Specs

Electrical

• Power Range: Up to 1200HP
• Input Voltage Class: 230, 480,690 VAC Classes
• Overload (30 seconds): Varies by unit. In general, 150%
• Rated Switching Frequency: 2 – 16kHz, varies by unit
• Maximum Switching Frequency: 16kHz with derate

Mechanical

• Cooling Type: Flat back, Fan, Liquid Cooled, Push Through

Certifications

• cULus
• CE

Environment

• Protection Rating: IP20
• Rated Altitude: 1000m with derate possible

Control

(Application version)

• Motor Types: Induction, PM Servo, Linear, Torque
• Motor Control: V/Hz, SMM, field-orientated with encoder, ASCL, SCL
• Control Types: Velocity, Position, Torque, Homing
• Internal Positioning: Yes. 32-bit register

Options

The following communication interfaces are available:
• Serial, RS232/485 (DIN 66019-II)
• DeviceNet
• Modbus
• Profibus
• Interbus
• CANopen
• Sercos
• Modbus TCP
• Ethernet TCP/IP
• EtherCAT
• Powerlink
• Profinet
• Ethernet/IP

Encoder Interfaces
The following feedback devices are supported:
• TTL
• HTL
• Resolver
• Sin/Cos
• SSI-Sin/Cos
• EnDAT 2.1
• EnDAT 2.2
• BiSS
• Hiperface
• UVW

Functional Safety
Dual-channel SIL3-rated Safe-Torque-Off (STO) inputs are available as an option.

Heatsinks
The following heatsink options are available:
• Flatback
• Air-cooled (fan)
• Liquid-cooled
• Push through

Braking Resistor
Backmount braking resistors can be included through the G housing size. This option reduces the panel footprint.

EMI Filter
Backmount EMI filters can be included through the H housing size. This option reduces the panel footprint.

Related

Applications and How-Tos

VFDs for Single Phase Applications

Jonathan Bullick | June 28th, 2023
Applications and How-Tos

Brake chopper circuits in VFDs

Brian Holtzkamp | January 22nd, 2018

High Speed Motor Control

Jonathan Bullick | February 27th, 2020

body_html:
Servo Drives & VFDs

COMBIVERT F6 EtherCAT VFD

The COMBIVERT F6-K is a single axis drive platform offered through 1,200 Hp. The F6-K was built with realtime Ethernet communication and safety in mind. As standard, it includes EtherCAT, STO and a dual channel universal encoder interface.

Catalog Software
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

The F6-K is configured for EtherCAT communication as standard. A 125μS scan time makes the F6-K ideal for high-performance applications requiring real-time performance. A VARAN communication option is also available.

Features include 3 analog inputs which can be used to control advanced processes such as a hydraulic pump servo motor. This allows the user to handle the control within the drive rather than through an external PLC.

Dual-channel SIL3 rated Safe-Torque-Off (STO) input.

The F6-K can run different motor types: Induction motors, AC PM Servo motors, Torque motors, Reluctance motors, Spindle motors, Interior Permanent Magnet Motors, Linear motors, and High Speed motors

Dual-channel universal feedback interface. Supports Resolver, Incremental TTL, BiSS, SSI, SinCos, EnDAT 2.1, EnDAT 2.2, and Hiperface

The F6 is available in 230V and 480V classes – up to 1,200Hp.

Units feature integrated braking transistors and KTY/PTC motor temperature monitoring.

Tech Specs

Electrical

• Power Range: Up to 1200HP (liquid cooled)
• Input Voltage Class: 230, 480Vac
• Overload (30 seconds): Varies by unit. In general, 150%
• Rated Switching Frequency: 2 – 16kHz, varies by unit
• Maximum Switching Frequency: 16kHz with derate

Mechanical

• Cooling Type: Flat back, Fan, Push Through

Certifications

• cULus
• CE

Environment

• Protection Rating: IP20
• Rated Altitude: 1000m with derate possible

Control

• Motor Types: Induction, PM Servo, Linear, Torque, High Speed
• Motor Control: V/Hz, SMM™, field-orientated with encoder, ASCL™, SCL™
• Control Types: Velocity, Position, Torque, Homing
• Internal Positioning: Yes. 32-bit register

Options

BRAKING Transistor
A braking transistor can be included in the F6-K. This is not an external module but is compactly fit in the F6 drive.

Communication
EtherCAT communication is onboard and standard.
A VARAN option is also available.

Universal Feedback Interface

Related

Jonathan Bullick | February 17th, 2023

VFDs for Single Phase Applications

Jonathan Bullick | June 28th, 2023

Brian Holtzkamp | January 22nd, 2018

body_html:
Servo Drives & VFDs

COMBIVERT F6 VFD

KEB's Combivert F6 VFD is offered through 450kW and incorporates the latest drive technology. Flexibility and performance are the main focus and the units are offered with various communication, functional safety, heatsink, and control card options.

Catalog Manual Software
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

The F6 is offered in graduated sizes up to 450 kW. Both 230V and 480V classes are available with switching frequencies up to 16kHz.

Multiple control card options are available depending on application requirements. All drives feature dual-channel STO inputs and SM3 supports advanced Functional Safety modes including Failsafe over EtherCAT (FSoE).

The F6 supports EtherNet/IP, EtherCAT, Modbus TCP/IP, ProfiNet, and Powerlink communication protocols. The F6 operates a wide variety of motor types including induction, AC PM Servo, Linear, Torque, and Synchronous Reluctance motors. Motor modes and communication is software selectable.

Additionally, the F6 supports a variety of different cooling types. Forced air (fan cooled) is standard but push through and liquid-cooled heatsinks are also available.

Tech Specs

Electrical

• Power Range: Up to 400 kW
• Input Voltage Class: 230, 480Vac
• Overload (30 seconds): Varies by unit. In general, 150%
• Rated Switching Frequency: 2 – 16kHz, varies by unit
• Maximum Switching Frequency: 16kHz with derate

Mechanical

• Cooling Type: Flat back, Fan, Push Through, Liquid Cooled

Interfaces

Communication Interfaces:
Compact control card: EtherCAT, VARAN, CAN
Application control card: EtherCAT, EtherNet/IP, Modbus TCP/IP, ProfiNet, Powerlink, VARAN, CAN

 

Encoder Interfaces (Compact/Application card): Dual-channel supports TTL, HTL, Resolver, BiSS, EnDat 2.1, Hiperface, SSI.

The second channel can be software-selected as an Incremental Output.

 

Certification

• cULus
• CE

Control

• Motor Types: Induction, PM Servo, Linear, Torque, High Speed
• Motor Control: V/Hz, SMM, field-orientated with encoder, ASCL, SCL
• Control Types: Velocity, Position, Torque, Homing
• Internal Positioning: Yes. 32-bit register

Environment

• Protection Rating: IP20
• Rated Altitude: 1000m with derate possible

pro.ProductName: Secure Remote Access - Industrial VPN Router - KEB
body_html:
Router

Secure Remote Access

KEB's C6 Industrial Router provides a secure connection to controls in the field. It is 3rd-party compatible and can be used with Allen-Bradley, Siemens, and Schneider PLCs. It is the ideal tool for PLC remote maintenance and commissioning.

Router Catalog (Excerpt) Full Automation Catalog Manual
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

KEB’s C6 Industrial VPN Router provides remote access to new and legacy PLCs. All Serial and Ethernet-based PLCs are supported.

The Industrial Router uses a secure VPN connection through KEB’s global server network. Firewalls can be configured in the Router and data is transmitted via TLS/SSL security protocols.

KEB’s C6 Router is built for tough industrial environments. The unit is housed in a stainless steel enclosure and is ready for DIN rail or wall mount. It is powered with 24VDC and carries UL and CE approvals.

Using COMBIVIS Studio HMI, the Router can be configured as a data logging and remote monitoring tool. Events and alarms can also be programmed to trigger email or SMS message updates.

The C6 VPN Router is well suited for even the most remote installations. 4G is supported on GSM networks worldwide.

KEB’s COMBIVIS CONNECT software enhances the Router’s security. CONNECT allows extensive user management, firewall settings, and a timestamped user log.

Tech Specs

Electrical

• CPU Processor – ARM Cortex A8 processor Freescale i.MC535 1 GHz
• Microsoft Windows Embedded Compact 7
• 512 MB RAM
• 256 MB read-only NAND-flash (O.S. and Runtime)
• Between 2-4GB depending on model

Mechanical

DIN Rail Mount (35mm)

Certifications

• CE
• cULus LISTED

Interfaces

• WAN – Ethernet 10/100 Mbps (RJ45)
• LAN – Ethernet 100 Mbps (RJ45)
• USB – 1 x USB 2.0
• Serial – 1 x RS-232/422/485 (DB15M) optoisolated

Environment

• Operating temperature: 0 … +59 °C
• Storage temperature: -20 … +60 °C
• Relative humidity: 5 … 95 %, without condensation
• IP20

Technical Specifications

CPU
• Processor – ARM Cortex A8 processor Freescale
• i.MC535 1 GHz
• Microsoft Windows Embedded Compact 7

Memory
• 512 MB RAM
• 256 MB read-only NAND-flash (O.S. and Runtime)

Interfaces
• WAN – Ethernet 10/100 Mbps (RJ45)
• LAN – Ethernet 100 Mbps (RJ45)
• USB – 1 x USB 2.0
• Serial – 1 x RS-232/422/485 (DB15M) optoisolated

Digital I/Os

Input
• IN0 – Safety key for WAN connection. Function managed by COMBIVIS Control Center
• IN1 – C6 Router software reset
Type – 0 … 24 V DC, 55 V optoisolated
Output
• OUT0 – C6 Router WAN enabled connection signal
• OUT1 – Remote assistance service running signal
Type – Output with relay 200 mA/24 V DC max for contact (N.O. – normally open)
• Protection grade – IP20
• Operating temperature – 0 … +50 C
• Approvals – CE, cULus

Options

body_html:
Router

4G Cellular Router

The C6 industrial cellular router brings a 4G GSM connection to the control panel. Whether it’s a remote oil field or a distant water treatment plant, KEB's 4G Router is ideal for installations requiring secure access, data logging, and alarm handling.

Catalog Manual
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

The C6 Cellular Router is offered with a 4G connection and operates on GSM networks worldwide.

The C6 Router is able to connect to new and legacy PLC controls. It supports over 40 communication drivers including EtherNet/IP, Profinet, OPC, Modbus TCP, EtherCAT.

The router is designed for tough industrial applications. It is a DIN Rail mount and is powered with 24VDC.

The Edge Router supports standard MQTT and AMQP protocols. The solution can be easily scaled across industries and applications, including Water/Wastewater, SCADA, Renewable Energy, and Discrete Automation.

The Edge Router pushes data to Cloud-based services like AWS and Azure. From there, users can run further analytics, create user dashboards, and gather insights.

Tech Specs

Electrical

• CPU Processor – ARM Cortex A8 processor Freescale i.MC535 1 GHz
• Microsoft Windows Embedded Compact 7
• 512 MB RAM
• 256 MB read-only NAND-flash (O.S. and Runtime)
• Between 2-4GB depending on model

Mechanical

DIN Rail Mount (35mm)

Certifications

• CE
• cULus LISTED

Interfaces

• WAN – Ethernet 10/100 Mbps (RJ45)
• LAN – Ethernet 100 Mbps (RJ45)
• USB – 1 x USB 2.0
• Serial – 1 x RS-232/422/485 (DB15M) optoisolated
• 1 x SIM Card (mini) socket push-push type (available in GSM Cellular model)
• 1 x SMA plug (various additional antenna options) (available in GSM Cellular model)

Environment

• Operating temperature: 0 … +59 °C
• Storage temperature: -20 … +60 °C
• Relative humidity: 5 … 95 %, without condensation
• IP20

Technical Specifications

CPU
• Processor – ARM Cortex A8 processor Freescale
• i.MC535 1 GHz
• Microsoft Windows Embedded Compact 7

Memory

• 256 MB read-only NAND-flash (O.S. and Runtime)

Interfaces
• WAN – Ethernet 10/100 Mbps (RJ45)
• LAN – Ethernet 100 Mbps (RJ45)
• USB – 1 x USB 2.0
• Serial – 1 x RS-232/422/485 (DB15M) optoisolated

Digital I/Os

Input
• IN0 – Safety key for WAN connection. Function managed by COMBIVIS Control Center
• IN1 – C6 Router software reset
Type – 0 … 24 V DC, 55 V optoisolated

• OUT1 – Remote assistance service running signal
Type – Output with relay 200 mA/24 V DC max for contact (N.O. – normally open)
• Protection grade – IP20
• Operating temperature – 0 … +50 C
• Approvals – CE, cULus

Options

• Cellular network
• Standard 2G/3G/3G+/4G EDGE/HSPA quadriband up to 5.76 Mbps upload/14.4 Mbps download
• SMAStecker auxiliary diversity antenna
• SIM card mini socket push-push type

Memory
• 2 GB eMMC solid state drive
• 4 GB eMMC solid state drive

Software
• COMBIVIS connect
• COMBIVIS HMI

MQTT
An optional MQTT push agent is available for pushing data to IoT Cloud platforms like AWS, Microsoft Azure, etc.

Related

Applications and How-Tos

Remote Access to Allen Bradley PLCs

Colin Zauner | November 7th, 2016
Applications and How-Tos

Remote Access to Schneider PLCs

Colin Zauner | December 3rd, 2018
Applications and How-Tos

Application of NAT rules with the C6 Router

Colin Zauner | October 29th, 2018

How Do Industrial Cellular Routers Work?

4G industrial cellular routers enable fast, reliable connection between multiple devices and peripherals, from PLCs to sensors. They leverage IP-based 4G networks to send and receive data, creating secure machine connectivity at any location or installation.

All data received by the 4G industrial router is transferred to a cloud-based service (like AWS) through MQTT communication, where it can be analyzed and distributed via SMS or email. This technology provides a comprehensive system for gathering, interpreting, and disseminating machine data to improve overall performance while reducing costly maintenance trips to the installation site.

4G industrial cellular routers offer better response time and lower latency than legacy solutions, driving faster connectivity for machines in the field. Designed for data security and robust dependability, 4G routers are a natural choice for remote installations and harsh environments. KEB models are made with rugged, industrial materials with no moving parts or fans, along with cULus approvals and an IP20 protection grade.

C6 Router with 4G

Advantages of 4G Industrial Routers

High-quality 4G industrial routers are designed for flexibility. For example, KEB’s C6 router offers additional HMI functionality for data logging, long-term machine diagnostics, and notification via email and SMS. This versatility makes the C6 useful for remote monitoring of devices through Ethernet or serial interface. The C6 can also be used on any GSM network in any country.

Compatibility with VPN connection software (like COMBIVIS Connect) is another unique advantage of 4G industrial routers. This technology empowers users to monitor a plant or installation from their workplace through a highly secure VPN. Moreover, KEB 4G routers offer worldwide support through multiple server locations to ensure continuous network connection.

Applications for 4G Industrial Routers

A 4G industrial router is a definitive tool for remote PLC maintenance and commissioning, particularly in hard-to-reach locations and installations. This utility makes them suitable for real-time facility monitoring and internal communication across wastewater treatment systems.

Renewable energy and wind power applications can monitor and maintain isolated assets in the field, such as wind turbines, with the help of a 4G industrial router. Other typical applications include oil fields, SCADA, and Discrete Automation.

KEB’s C6 industrial cellular router helps machine builders and IoT system integrators maximize site efficiency and safety through remote PLC maintenance. Our solution makes it easy for users to perform analytics, gauge KPIs, and streamline their decision-making processes. Our team can help you select the optimal router for your unique application needs.

Wind Power Applications IoT System

body_html:
Industrial PCs

C6 E22 IPC

The E22 is a powerful multi-core industrial PC boasting a 64-bit Intel® Bay Trail chipset. The E22 has an EtherCAT master and is ideal for 10+ axes of real-time coordinated motion control. It is available in panel, box, and book configurations.

Catalog Installation Manual
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

C6 E22 PANEL IPC – Ideal for high-performance industrial machines requiring coordinated motion control and CNC functionality
64-bit architecture, Celeron® J1900 2Ghz (2,41 GHz burst frequency), 4 cores, 4 threads –
• Glass front panel
• Capacitive or resistive touch technology
• IP66 protection class
• Full HD resolution
• USB interface on the front
• A variety of formats and sizes available

C6 E22 BOX
An all-in-one motherboard, room for add-on interfaces, and optional expansion slots make the E22 Box perfect for wall mounting in a cabinet.
• 2 Ethernet interfaces
• 1 USB 3.0 and 3 USB 2.0 interfaces
• 1 RS232 Serial interface
• DVI-D monitor output
• Expansion slot for additional fieldbus cards (BOX S1 model)

C6 E22 BM
The sleek C6 E22 Book Mount is perfect for mounting in a control cabinet. All of the necessary interfaces are located on the top and front of the device, so installation is a breeze. The status display on the front provides useful operating info at a glance.
• DVI or RVL output interfaces
• 4 Ethernet interfaces
• UPS and backup battery
• Optional 2.5″ HDD/SSD

SLIM (SL) VERSION FOR SMALL SPACES
For installations in small spaces the Panel and Box E22 IPCs come in Slim versions.
The Panel SL is 48mm – 65mm in-depth, and the Box SL is 35mm in depth.

RUGGED DESIGN
Industrial PCs from KEB America are designed to work in industrial environments. A fanless design that limits moving parts and IP66 protection (panel and box) make the IPCs well-suited for installation on the factory floor.

Like our HMI, the Panel IPCs come in capacitive touch for precise movements like pinching and scrolling, or resistive touch for use with a glove or stylus.

PROCESSING POWER

Jonathan Bullick | February 17th, 2023

Why Use Industrial PCs?

Industrial PCs are compact and high-precision computers for industrial applications. Functionally, they work just like consumer PCs. However, industrial PCs often have higher memory capacity, computing power, and more durable parts to ensure reliable performance. Use cases for IPCs include factories, refineries, labs, water treatment plants, and packaging facilities.

Industrial work environments are demanding and expose computers to adverse conditions, from airborne dust to high temperatures. Industrial PCs are built to resist these environmental factors, utilizing fanless, ventless designs to maximize efficiency and minimize the risk of parts failing. Indeed, this is how IPCs can perform in the field with minimal maintenance.

Flexibility is a crucial advantage for industrial PCs. These computers are available in multiple configurations to accommodate even the most challenging applications. Remote connectivity allows users to monitor IPCs across the plant floor or in the field without expensive, time-consuming trips. This versatility helps customers achieve greater efficiency, enable more productive workflows, and control risk in any industrial application.

C6 E22 Configurations

The C6 E22 IPC is available in three different configurations to help users integrate with existing systems, maximize throughput, and redefine performance in applications requiring real-time motion control:

Panel IPC

The C6 E22 can be configured as an industrial touch screen panel PC, complete with capacitive and resistive touch features. Its industrial computer display allows for seamless visualization of machine data—and includes impressive operating capabilities for most applications.

Box IPC

C6 E22 box IPCs include a compact design for use in equipment manufacturing and industrial automation. From regulating process and machine data to driving CNC functionality, the C6 box IPC is a good fit for applications with strict space and ruggedness requirements.

Book Mount IPC

The C6 E22 can be configured as a compact book mount IPC for use in control cabinets. This variant is easy to handle, with minimum housing dimensions and all required connections placed at the front and top of the device.

Choosing an IPC for Your Industrial Application

There are many important factors to consider when choosing an industrial PC. Here are some general guidelines to help get you started:

Environment plays a key role in IPC selection. Work environments exposed to dust, debris, shocks, vibration, or high temps will require a more rugged PC with protective features. For example, a factory floor will benefit from IPCs that limit the number of moving parts in the system. KEB’s C6 E22 industrial touchscreen panel PC pairs a fanless design with IP66 protection, making it an ideal choice for factory applications.

Performance is another important consideration when picking an IPC or industrial PC panel. Your computer needs the appropriate processing power to handle required tasks and workloads. This is a delicate balance: too much power creates unneeded costs and waste—while too little results in performance failures and downtime. For instance, you may focus on a great industrial computer display to improve data visualization, only to be hit with workflow interruptions due to insufficient processing power.

These are just a few elements you’ll need to consider when selecting an IPC. For the best results, we recommend connecting with a KEB solutions engineer. From industrial PC panel solutions to cutting-edge tools for CNC automation, our experts will help you find the perfect technology for your unique application needs.

Admin | February 25th, 2020

What Are Industrial PCs?

An industrial PC (or IPC) is a fanless, ventless computing device, purpose-built for industrial applications. IPCs offer high precision and dependability standards—and are designed for use in demanding work environments. These machines are smart, cost-effective tools that merge human-machine interface (HMI) and control functionalities.

Versatility is of paramount importance for industrial PCs. These computers must integrate with many different forms of industrial machines, applications, and contexts, without the need for excessive customization. This is why IPCs like the C6 P34 merge high performance with flexible configurations, including the following:

Panel IPCs are outfitted with responsive touchscreen panels, making it easy for users to monitor and operate industrial machines. These panel solutions streamline the visualization of equipment and system data, giving operators greater control over process and machine operation than ever before.

Box IPCs operate with remarkable stability and safety, even in demanding environments. Their robust and compact design allows box IPCs to resist harmful environmental factors, from high-temperature shifts to airborne substances like dust and debris.

Book Mount IPCs are specially designed with a compact form for use in control cabinets. They encompass a wide range of operating systems and processors to support almost any industrial automation workflow. Book mount IPCs are also designed for ease of access, with all connections and plug-in points built into the front and top of the computer.

How Do Industrial PCs Work?

An industrial PC includes many of the same functions and parts as a standard desktop computer. The big difference is that IPCs include rugged features to endure hostile conditions in industrial settings, including temperatures and power spikes.

For example, IPCs can be outfitted with special filters and shock absorbers to protect the computer from dust, extreme vibration, and movement. These protective features are especially useful for IPCs installed in remote locations that are difficult to service in the field.

With the addition of industrial display monitors, IPCs act as comprehensive machine controllers, enabling real-time CNC and other functionalities. KEB’s C6 panel IPC delivers a powerful combination of coordinated motion control with capacitive and resistive touch options for more productive, intuitive, and safe operations.

Industrial Applications for IPCs

Packaging, data acquisition, industrial automation, and even mining applications all benefit greatly from the efficient, robust design of IPCs. Their long life cycles and minimal need for maintenance allow industrial PCs to excel in these challenging environments.

Other growing industrial applications for IPCs include the food and beverage industries, both of which demand reliable machine performance amidst potential messes, spills, and contaminants. KEB’s HMI touch screen panels and panel IPCs offer exceptional moisture and water resistance, making washdowns and equipment cleaning safe and easy.

KEB leads the way in control and automation for industrial applications. Our next-generation industrial PC devices equip customers with flexible computing capabilities with minimal need for repairs and inspections. This results in more seamless applications, greater throughput, and reduced risk and costs. Our experts will work with you every step of the way to create the right IPC solution for your application needs.

Contact Us

Lets Work Together

Connect with us today to learn more about our industrial automation solutions—and how to commission them for your application.

body_html:
Integral Gearmotors

HelicalWorm Gearmotors

KEB’s S-series combines the economy and high reduction of the worm gear with the efficiency of the helical. The S-series is ideally suited for applications requiring a right angle output. No matter what type of gearing you choose, KEB gearmotors are extremely flexible and customizable.

Manual Selection Software
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

content:
Integral Gearmotors
HelicalWorm Gearmotors
KEB’s S-series combines the economy and high reduction of the worm gear with the efficiency of the helical. The S-series is ideally suited for applications requiring a right angle output. No matter what type of gearing you choose, KEB gearmotors are extremely flexible and customizable.
Manual
Selection Software
Contact Us
Product Details
Tech Specs
Related
Product Details
Get all the benefits of economical worm gearing – high reductions with a right angle output
Integral design provides a compact design and lower weight compared to flanged designs
For applications requiring a right angle output, helical worm gearing is an excellent choice.
KEB worm gearboxes can be supplied with solid output shafts or hollow bores
Helical worm gearing can be added to a PM servo motor or an induction motor (IE2 & IE3)
Tech Specs
Electrical
• Voltage/Frequency combinations for different global installations
Mechanical
• Output Torque: Up to 15,000Nm
• Brake Option: KEB Spring-set Brake
• Backlash: 10-20 arm/min. as standard. Low backlash option exists
Environment
• Protection Type: IP55 standard. Up to IP65 available.
• Maximum Ambient Temperature: 40° C with possible derate
• Elevation: 1000m rated with possible derate
Options
Spring-set Brakes: Add a spring applied (spring-set) brake to your gearmotor. KEB COMBISTOP Spring Set brakes provide failsafe braking functionality with boosted coils for higher torque and a robust design for tough industrial applications.
KEB brakes provide power-off brake engagement. The brakes used are KEB’s Type 38 brake which includes common options like a manual hand release and micro switch. A quiet brake is available for theatre and stage applications.
Feedback devices: KEB motors can be configured with feedback devices. Common formats include: TTL, HTL, resolver, BiSS, and Hiperface.
Customized outputs: KEB can provide gearmotors with custom flanges or shafts to facilitate mounting to the machine. It is also possible to provide an output flange or shaft on both output sides.
Food Grade Lubricants: For use in food production, KEB gearmotors can be provided with food grade lubricants and greases.
Extra Environmental Protection: For use in washdown or corrosive environments, the gearmotors can be supplied with extra paint protection and seals.
Additional options include flange outputs, encoder, shaft couplers, food-grade lubricants, special paint
Related
Spring Applied Brakes

body_html:
Embedded Controls

C6 Smart

The C6 SMART embedded industrial PC provides multi-axis coordinated motion control and camming. It features an EtherCAT master and integrated EtherCAT bus coupler for the expansion of EtherCAT IO modules.

Catalog Installation Manual
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Options

Related

Product Details

The C6 SMART is a powerful embedded PC that is ideal for medium-high performance industrial machines requiring coordinated motion control.

The C6 SMART features an integrated EtherCAT communication bus. Expandable KEB I/O modules are easily added as required.

Visualization can be handled in the SMART. An integrated DVI output allows the connection of an industrial monitor.

Onboard memory capacity includes 8 GB for application, 4 GB for the operating system and runtime, 512 KB for persistent/retain variables.

Compact Size – The space-saving C6 SMART is only 47mm wide and is mounted on a DIN-rail.

Updating and programming the C6 SMART is fast and easy. For production, simply plug in a USB stick with the new program and power up the C6 Smart – the application will install itself.

KEB offers an onboard Micro-UPS as a standard feature. The Micro-UPS ensures critical machine data will not be lost in the event of a power failure.

Tech Specs

Electrical

• CPU: ARM iMX6 Quad/Dual Cortex-A9 @ 1 GHz
• System memory: RAM 1 GB
• Input Voltage: 18 – 36 VDC (micro-UPS)
• Operating System: Windows Embedded Compact 7 Pro
• HMI: COMBIVIS Studio HMI runtime
• Remote Control: COMBIVIS Connect
• System memory: 4 GB for operating system and runtime environments
• Application memory: 8 GB project memory for free use
• Retain memory: 128 KB persistent and retainNAND Flash; 4 GB MLC eMMC

Mechanical

• Dimensions (W x H x D): 47 x 122 x 124 mm
• Mounting Type: 35mm DIN rail

Certifications

• CE (EN 55022, EN 61000-3-2/3, EN 55024, EN 60950-1)
• cULus LISTED (61010)

Interfaces

• Ethernet 10/100/1000 Mbit/s
• EtherCAT master
• E-Bus LVDS port
• DVI-D interface
• 2x USB 2.0
• Multi-color LED diagnostic interface
• CAN (optional)
• Serial (optional)

Environment

• Protection Rating: IP20
• Operating Temperature: 0 … 50 °C
• Storage Temperature: -20 … 60 °C

Options

Hardware
• Optoisolated CAN 2.0
• Multi-serial port optoisolated RS232/485

Software
• Windows Embedded Compact 7 or optional Linux
• Control: RTE-Basic, RTE-Pro, or RTE-Advanced
• Visualization: HMI-Basic, or HMI-Advanced
• Remote maintenance: Connect

Related

KEB Technology

Combivis Studio 6: A New Path to Project Development

Colin Zauner | February 22nd, 2016
Applications and How-Tos

Master-slave drive applications

Jonathan Bullick | June 18th, 2018
Applications and How-Tos

Colin Zauner | March 1st, 2022
Applications and How-Tos

Setup Guide: KEB VFD EtherCAT Communication with a Beckhoff PLC

Colin Zauner | March 29th, 2022

Integral Gearmotors

Helical Inline Gearmotor

KEB's integral gearmotors with inline gearing combine a motor and gearbox into one compact and efficient package. No matter which type of gearing you choose, KEB gearmotors are extremely flexible and customizable.

Manual Selection Software
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

Integral design provides a compact design and lower weight compared to flanged designs

High quality German-cut gearing provides 94-96% efficiency

KEB helical gears are prepared to DIN 3990 specifications

Highly configurable with different flange, encoder, brake, and paint options

Extra high torque options available with double gearbox reductions

 

Tech Specs

Electrical

• Voltage/Frequency combinations for different global installations

Mechanical

• Output Torque: Up to 15,000Nm
• Brake Option: KEB Spring-set Brake
• Backlash: 10-20 arm/min. as standard. Low backlash option exists

Environment

• Protection Type: IP55 standard. Up to IP65 available.
• Maximum Ambient Temperature: 40° C with possible derate
• Elevation: 1000m rated with possible derate

Options

Spring-set Brakes: Add a spring applied (spring-set) brake to your gearmotor. KEB COMBISTOP Spring Set brakes provide failsafe braking functionality with boosted coils for higher torque and a robust design for tough industrial applications.

KEB brakes provide power-off brake engagement. The brakes used are KEB’s Type 38 brake which includes common options like a manual hand release and micro switch. A quiet brake is available for theatre and stage applications.

Feedback devices: KEB motors can be configured with feedback devices. Common formats include: TTL, HTL, resolver, BiSS, and Hiperface.

Customized outputs: KEB can provide gearmotors with custom flanges or shafts to facilitate mounting to the machine. It is also possible to provide an output flange or shaft on both output sides.

Food Grade Lubricants: For use in food production, KEB gearmotors can be provided with food grade lubricants and greases.

Extra Environmental Protection: For use in washdown or corrosive environments, the gearmotors can be supplied with extra paint protection and seals.

Additional options include flange outputs, encoder, shaft couplers, food-grade lubricants, special paint

body_html:
Gearing

Planetary Gearheads

Planetary gearheads from KEB America are low backlash with the industry’s highest torque density. KEB Planetary gearheads offer 97% efficiency, optimized output bearing, and precision cut gearing.

Catalog Software
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

KEB planetary gearheads are compact and ideal for demanding motion control applications

Available in both inline and right angle configurations

Customers can choose their output shaft, lubrication type, clamping system, and input flange.

Applications include revolving tables, robotic- and handling devices, tool changers and linear positioning.

A universal design easy mounting system makes the gearheads suitable for all installation positions.

Life-time lubrication ensures minimal maintenance once the gears are in place.

17 exact ratios are available (from 3:1 to 100:1)

Tech Specs

Mechanical

• Nominal output torque: Up to 210Nm
• Max output torque: Up to 736Nm
• Input speeds: 1100 … 5000 rpm

Tech Specs

• Ratios: 3:1 … 100:1
• Efficiency at full load: 97%
• Operating temperature range: -13 … 194 F
• Standard backlash: <7 … <19, depending on model
• Running noise: 58 … 70 dB

Options

Optional output shaft with feather key or smooth finish

Lifetime lubrication options: standard, food-grade, or low-temperature lubrication

Universal or two-part motor-adapted flange available

Related

DL3 Servo Motors

Options
Spring-set Brakes: Add a spring applied (spring-set) brake to your gearmotor. KEB COMBISTOP Spring Set brakes provide failsafe braking functionality with boosted coils for higher torque and a robust design for tough industrial applications.
KEB brakes provide power-off brake engagement. The brakes used are KEB’s Type 38 brake which includes common options like a manual hand release and micro switch. A quiet brake is available for theatre and stage applications.
Feedback devices: KEB motors can be configured with feedback devices. Common formats include: TTL, HTL, resolver, BiSS, and Hiperface.
Customized outputs: KEB can provide gearmotors with custom flanges or shafts to facilitate mounting to the machine. It is also possible to provide an output flange or shaft on both output sides.
Food Grade Lubricants: For use in food production, KEB gearmotors can be provided with food grade lubricants and greases.
Extra Environmental Protection: For use in washdown or corrosive environments, the gearmotors can be supplied with extra paint protection and seals.
Additional options include flange outputs, encoder, shaft couplers, food-grade lubricants, special paint

body_html:
High-Power. High-Torque.

DL4 Servo Motors

KEB's DL4 servo motors are compact in size but generate a lot of torque. The rated torque values range from 11 Nm to 520 Nm and rated motor speeds from 1,000 to 3,000 rpm, with peak speeds up to 6,000 rpm.

These permanent magnet synchronous servo motors offer the highest dynamic performance for applications in plastics, metalworking, textile, and woodworking.

Catalog Manual
Contact Us

Product Details

Technical Specs

Resources

Product Details

KEB DL4 servo motors are dynamic 8-pole motors as standard with speeds from 1000 rpm to 3,000 rpm (varies by model). They are available in 400V.

For maximum flexibility, KEB servo motors are provided with rotatable connectors.

KEB servo motors utilize neodymium permanent magnets to provide exceptional torque density. Units are rated for maximum torques of at least 300% of the rated continuous stall current.

KEB servos offer up to 11Nm nominal torque and 520Nm peak torque.

Motor coating – Varnishing RAL 9005.

Technical Specs

Electrical

• Voltage Class: 400V
• Motor Poles: 8

Mechanical

• Duty: S1 continuous
• Other duties possible – contact KEB
• Certifications: cUL and CE
• Max nominal torque: 11Nm (no Fan)
• Max nominal torque: 520Nm (forced ventilation)

Certification

• cUL and CE certified

Environment

• Protection Type: IP54 standard. IP65 – without ventilation (with shaft sealing ring D-side)

• Operating Temperature: 0 … 40° C

• Relative Humidity: < 90 % (no condensation)

• Site Altitude: ≤ 1000 m above sea level

Options

Encoder system connection – M23 connector (for SE CS rotatable)

Encoder systems

-Without encoder (SCL operation)

-Resolver

-Hiperface SRS50 – 16 bit

-Hiperface SRM50 – 16 bit / Multiturn – 12 bit

 

Resources

KEB Technology

How Large Servo Motors Are Transforming Industrial Machinery

Jonathan Bullick | October 10th, 2023
Applications and How-Tos

How Servo Motors Enhance Press and Metalworking Applications

Jonathan Bullick | October 31st, 2023
KEB Technology

Washdown Servo Motor for Harsh Environments

Jonathan Bullick | November 6th, 2023
Applications and How-Tos

KEB Servo Pump System for Molding and Press Machines

Scott Froehle | November 14th, 2023
UL-Certified. UL-Listed.

DL4 Frame Sizes

KEB's DL4 motors are available in both unventilated and forced-ventilated versions, and the motor power can be adjusted to match the demands of your application. These compact, brushless servo motors can seamlessly interface with gear units using adapters for added flexibility.

SE

Max. Rated Power (6.6 kW)
Rated Speed (1500 - 3000 rpm)
Peak Speed (6000 rpm)
Rated Torque (up to 28.1 Nm)
Peak Torque (up to 92.33 Nm)

SF

Max. Rated Power (15.7 kW)
Rated Speed (1000 - 3000 rpm)
Peak Speed (6000 rpm)
Rated Torque (up to 88 Nm)
Peak Torque (up to 88 Nm)

SG

Max. Rated Power (76.9* kW [S3 Duty])
Rated Speed (1000 - 3000 rpm)
Peak Speed (6000 rpm)
Rated Torque (342* Nm [S3 Duty])
Peak Torque (454 Nm)
Software. Motors. Drives.

Servo Systems

KEB’s Combivis 6 commissioning and diagnostic software manages the S6 and F6 servo motor controllers with DL4 motors to deliver high-torque, efficiency, and control accuracy in large power industrial applications.

pro.ProductName: Spring Applied Brakes - Power Off - KEB
body_html:
Brakes

Spring Applied Brakes

KEB DC brakes provide failsafe spring-set (power-off) brake engagement. The electromagnetic brakes are electrically released and typically mounted on a motor or drive shaft. KEB brakes are designed for tough applications and can be selected for dynamic, holding, and e-stop braking.

Catalog Install Manual
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

3D Models

Related

Product Details

Power-off spring-set (failsafe) brake engagement.

Proven design with few wear parts – No linkages. No solenoids. No moving parts to wear and replace

KEB spring applied brakes use multiple springs – each rated for 10+ million cycles

Can be dimensioned for dynamic, holding (parking), and e-stop applications

Options like manual hand release, microswitch for brake engagement feedback, and IP66 protection

High quality machined parts. Unique airgap adjustment using hollow spacers. The airgap can be readjusted to compensate for lining wear. This effectively increases the brake’s operating lifetime by 3X

Scalable sizes from several in-lbs to 2000 ft-lb

Tech Specs

Electrical

• DC Coil Voltage: 12, 24, 48, 105, 205 VDC Standard (Custom upon request)
• Duty: 100% on
• Insulation Class: B (F available as option)
• Approvals: CSA, CE

Mechanical

• Type: Spring-set, electrically released
• Torque Range: 0.25 to 2000 ft-lbs

Certifications

CSA on Standard product

Environment

• Environmental Rating: IP20 standard (IP65 available)

Options

Manual Hand Release: A manual hand release allows the brake to be opened without electrical power.
A locking hand release option is also available.

Microswitch to verify the brake state or monitor lining wear.

Torque Adjustment Ring: A torque adjustment ring allows the torque to be manually adjusted and lowered by up to 50%.

Noise Reduced: The brake incorporates design features to reduce brake actuation noise.
The solution is rated <65dB @ 1 meter. Effectively, more quiet than the gearbox or switching contactors.

IP65 Rating: The brake is fully enclosed and incorporates gaskets and o-rings – Perfect for outdoor or washdown applications.

Double Brakes: Two independent redundant electrical and magnet circuits.
Meets DIN56921 and BGV C1 requirements.

Dust Protection Ring: Economical solution to protect against ingress of dust and debris. Rated IP44.

Prepared for Encoder: The brake can be prepared with tapped holes to allow the direct mounting of a motor encoder or tachometer.

Secondary Friction Surface: A secondary friction surface provides a suitable counter-rotation surface to prevent wear on the mounting device. It can also incorporate a custom bolt circle for the application.

Connectors: Special connectors can be added per the customers specification.

Conduit Box: A terminal box or conduit fitting can be added for terminal wiring.

3D Models

  • Pilot bore shown - contact KEB with questions

body_html:
Servo Motors

DL3 Servo Motors

KEB AC synchronous servo motors offer dynamic control for demanding positioning and cycling applications. KEB servo motors are offered with low and medium inertia models. They can be configured with various feedback and brake options.

Catalog Manual
Contact Us

Product Details

Technical Specs

Related

Product Details

KEB servo motors are available in two voltage classes: 200V & 400V.

KEB servos are dynamic 6-pole motors as standard with maximum speeds up to 9,000rpm (varies by model).

For maximum flexibility, KEB servo motors are provided with rotatable connectors.

KEB servo motors utilize neodymium permanent magnets to provide exceptional torque density. Units are rated for maximum torques of at least 300% of the rated continuous stall current.

KEB servos offer up to 70Nm nominal torque and 245Nm peak torque.

Special IP and paint protection are available for outdoor and washdown applications.

Technical Specs

Electrical

• Voltage Class: 200V and 400V
• Motor Poles: 6-pole is standard (8 is optional)
• Excitation type: Sinusoidal
• Insulation class: F
• Wire insulation class: H

Mechanical

• Duty: S1 continuous
• Other duties possible – contact KEB
• Certifications: cUL and CE
• Max nominal torque: 70Nm (no Fan)
• Max nominal torque: 110Nm (forced ventilation)

Certification

• cUL and CE certified

Environment

• Protection Type: IP65 standard (shaft seal IP64)
• Operating Temperature: -20 … 40° C

Options

• SIL2 Encoder options

body_html:
Brakes

Load Brakes

KEB load (parking) brakes are specially designed for hoist and winch applications. The brakes are typically placed on the drum side of a hoist and provide silent operation. Their small footprint allows them to be placed in compact winch designs.

09 Manual (250-1500Nm) 09 Spec Sheet (250-1500Nm) Theatre Catalog
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

3D Models

Related

Product Details

Power-off spring-set (failsafe) brake engagement is ideal for safety critical applications like Hoists and Winches

Noise reduced design features are standard. Less than 65dB measured at 1 meter away

Integrated mounting flange options. Generic flange for bulkhead mounting. Or, SEW and KEB gearmotor patterns

Manual hand release and microswitch options

High Capacity – 250Nm up to 1500Nm in graduated torque offerings

Compact design – Approximately 50% lighter than competing products

Tech Specs

Electrical

• DC Coil Voltage: 24, 105, 170, 205, 270 VDC Standard (Custom upon request)
• Duty: 100% on
• Insulation Class: F (H available as option)
• Approvals: CSA, CE

Mechanical

• Type: Spring-set, electrically released
• Torque Range: 250 – 1500 Nm

Certifications

CSA

Environment

• Environmental Rating: IP44 with Rubber Dust ring

Options

• Manual Hand Release
A manual hand release allows the brake to be opened without electrical power.
If no hand release is required, the brake will be provided with release bolts.

• Microswitch
A microswitch is used as a secondary check to verify the brake state.

• Hub Bore Size
Hub bores can be specified in metric or imperial units.

• Mounting Flange

Customers can choose the right flange for their installation – generic, KEB or SEW patterns, or shaft mount with torque arm.

3D Models

pro.ProductName: Double C Face Brakes - Power Off - KEB
body_html:
Brakes

Double C Face Brakes

KEB Double C-Face brakes allow a failsafe spring-set brake to be easily added to a standard NEMA C-Face motor. This is ideal for retrofit applications or when a modular solution with a separate brake is desired. Graduated torque ratings are offered from 56C to 256TC frame sizes.

Catalog Manual
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

3D Models

Related

Product Details

Easily add a power-off brake to standard NEMA C-Face motors. From 56C to 256TC frame sizes. Up to 110 lbs.ft.

Self-contained design with integrated bearing supports and NEMA input/output flanges

Various coil voltages including 12VDC, 24VDC, 105VDC, and 205VDC coils. AC rectifier can be included for 230VAC and 460VAC installations.

NEMA 4X design (using suggested sealing methods). Optional features like nickel plated shafts and corrosive resistant paint treatment.

Can be mounted either horizontally or vertically (large breaks may require a mounting kit – discuss with a KEB engineer for vertical mount applications).

Tech Specs

Electrical

• DC Coil Voltage: 12, 24, 48, 105, 205 VCD Standard (Custom upon request)
• Duty: 100% on
• Insulation Class: B as standard (F & H available as an option)

Mechanical

• Type: Spring-set, electrically released
• Torque Range: 3 to 75 lbft

Environment

• Protection: NEMA 4 with proper sealing

Options

Locking hand release option

Low power heater reduces condensation build-up for applications in a humid environment

A microswitch can verify the brake state and be fed back to a control

Locking Hand Release: The hand release can be locked in the open position. This allows for hands-free maintenance.

3D Models

  • This field is for validation purposes and should be left unchanged.

body_html:
Motors

Brake Motors

KEB’s brake motors combine the latest motor technology with robust DC spring-set brakes. The brakes can be equipped with a number of different options including noise-reduced versions for theater applications. KEB motors have relatively low inertia making them ideal for high cycle applications such as conveyors or indexers.

Catalog Software
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

KEB motors are available with different worldwide voltages and are offered in IE2 or IE3 efficiency levels.

At the heart of the brake motor is KEB’s spring-set brake. The brakes can be featured with a number of different options including a manual hand release or noise-reduced versions for theater applications.

KEB motors have relatively low inertia making them ideal for high cycle applications such as conveyors or indexers.

KEB motors feature class F insulation and are VFD ready.

KEB brakemotors can be equipped with feedback devices as well. Standard encoder formats supplied are TTL, HTL, Sin/Cos, and BiSS.

KEB motors are rated IP54 as standard. Optional IP65 versions using KEB’s Type 28 spring-set brake are also available for washdown applications.

Tech Specs

Electrical

• Voltage class: 230V and 460V are standard (208, 400, 500, 690 available upon request)
• Motor poles: 4 is standard; 2, 6, 8 and multi-pole designs are optional
• Insulation class: F

Mechanical

• TEFC standard
• Duty cycle: S1 continuous standard
• S2, S3, S4 available (Fanless designs)
• Explosion Proof: ATEX Zone 1, 2, 21, or 22 available

Certifications

• UL
• CE

Environment

• Protection Type: IP54 standard (IP65 optional)
• Operating Temperature: -20 … 40° C
• Maximum altitude: 1000m with possible derate above

Options

A variety of different winding configurations are available for different voltage and frequency requirements.

Optional IP65 designs can be supplied for protection

All KEB spring-set brake options are offered including quiet brake design, manual hand release, microswitch, adjustable torque ring

For the encoder standard formats offered include Incremental (TTL and HTL), BiSS and Sin/Cos

IEC B5 and B14 flanged motors are also available up to IEC size 225 (60Hp)

Optional IP65 versions using KEB’s Type 28 spring-set brake are also available for washdown applications.

NEMA C-Face flanges are available through 215TC (7.5Hp).

Related

News, Technical Papers

Motor Thermal Protection

Jonathan Bullick | November 12th, 2022

Spring Applied Brakes

Admin | March 4th, 2020

Double C Face Brakes

Admin | March 4th, 2020

body_html:
Feedback Cables

Feedback Cables

KEB encoder cable systems provide robotic-grade noise-immune signal transmission. All KEB feedback cables are equipped with connectors to ensure compatibility with KEB drive products. This provides quick, noise immune, and error-free connections.

Catalog
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

KEB offers cables for different feedback formats, including Incremental, Resolver, EnDat, Hiperface and BiSS.

KEB encoder cables are robotic grade quality. They have small bend radii and support a long lifetime of bends.

As standard, they are rated for use up to 80 °C.

KEB offers specially designed feedback cables for extra long cable runs – up to 100 meters when used with a KEB VFD.

KEB cables are double shielded. For the best possible noise immunity, KEB cables contain twisted pair wires.

Each twisted pair contains its own shield and all the conductors are surrounded by an additional outer shield.

Tech Specs

Mechanical

• Signal formats available: Incremental, Resolver, Hiperface, BiSS, EnDAT 2.1, EnDAT 2.2
• Length: 1 to 100 meters
• Sheath material: PUR

Environment

• Maximum Temperature: 80 °C

body_html:
Motors

IEC Motors

KEB motors are offered up to IEC frame 225 and feature efficient IE3 winding technology.

Catalog Software
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

KEB motors feature class F insulation and are VFD-ready.

KEB brakemotors can be equipped with feedback devices

Standard encoder formats supplied are TTL, HTL, Sin/Cos, and BiSS.

KEB brake motors are rated IP54 as standard.

KEB motors are available with different worldwide voltages and are offered in IE2 or IE3 efficiency levels.

Tech Specs

Electrical

• Voltage class: 230V and 460V are standard (208, 400, 500, 690 available upon request)
• Motor poles: 4 is standard; 2, 6, 8 and multi-pole designs are optional
• Insulation class: F

Mechanical

• TEFC standard
• Duty cycle: S1 continuous standard
• S2, S3, S4 available (Fanless designs)
• Explosion Proof: ATEX Zone 1, 2, 21, or 22 available

Certifications

• UL
• CE

Environment

• Protection Type: IP54 standard (IP65 optional)
• Operating Temperature: -20 … 40° C
• Maximum altitude: 1000m with possible derate above

Options

A variety of different winding configurations are available for different voltage and frequency requirements.

Optional IP65 designs can be supplied for protection

All KEB spring-set brake options are possible including quiet brake design, manual hand release, microswitch, adjustable torque ring

For the encoder standard formats offered include Incremental (TTL and HTL), BiSS and Sin/Cos

Related

News, Technical Papers

The C6 EtherCAT analog I/O connects physical sensors to the EtherCAT bus. KEB analog I/O are offered in various terminal densities, resolutions, and interface types.

Tech Specs

Product Details

AI4/8-U (CoE)
Analog inputs: 8 single-ended or 4 differential

Measurement range: 0…10 V, ±10 V

body_html:
Servo Drives & VFDs

COMBIVERT S6 Servo Drive

KEB’s S6 Servo Drive is ideal for high-performance servo applications requiring real-time communication, advanced SIL3 safety functionality, and integrated brake control.

The S6 supports many of the leading communication protocols - EtherCAT, EtherNet/IP, Modbus TCP/IP, Profinet, and Powerlink.

Catalog Manual Software
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

The COMBIVERT S6 servo drive offers real-time EtherCAT communication. Other ethernet-based communication formats supported are EtherNet/IP, Modbus TCP/IP, ProfiNet IRT, Powerlink, and VARAN.

The S6 is narrow with a compact footprint, allowing the drives to be closely mounted together. Housing 2 (up to 2.2kW) is only 50mm wide while housing 4 (up to 7.5kW) is only 90mm wide.

As standard, the S6 includes SIL3 Safe-Torque-Off (STO) and Safe-Brake-Control (SBC) functionality. Extra safety functionality according to ISO 13849 is available, including SS1, SS2, SOS, SLS, SLP, SLI, SDI, SSM. Failsafe over EtherCAT (FSoE) is also available.

Includes an integrated brake output – rated for 2 Amps @ 24VDC.

The S6 servo drive is extremely flexible when it comes to feedback devices. The interface is dual-channel allowing configuration as input or output. Many formats are supported including Incremental TTL/HTL, Resolver, EnDAT 2.1, EnDAT 2.2, Hiperface, and BiSS.

The S6 EtherCAT Servo Drive uses the CiA 402 motion control profile and has an internal 32-bit positioning module for single-axis motion control applications.

Tech Specs

Electrical

• Power Range: Up to 5.5kW (Larger sizes should use the F6-K)
• Input Voltage Range: 184 … 528VAC
• Overload, 3 seconds: 250%
• Overload, 60 seconds: 200%
• Rated Switching Frequency: 8kHz
• Max. Switching Frequency: 16kHz with derate

Mechanical

• Cooling Type: Fan
• Certifications: cULus, CE

Control

• Motor Types: Induction, PM Servo, Linear, Torque
• Motor Control: V/Hz, SMM, field-orientated with encoder, ASCL, SCL
• Control Types: Velocity, Position, Torque, Homing

Certifications

• cULus
• CE

Environment

• Protection Rating: IP20
• Rated Altitude: 1000m with derating up to 2000m

Interfaces

Communication
EtherCAT communication is supplied as standard.
Optional communication interfaces are:
• Modbus TCP/IPPowerlink
• Profinet IRT
• VARAN
• CAN (included on all units)

 

Encoder Interfaces (Compact/Application card): Dual-channel supports TTL, HTL, Resolver, BiSS, EnDat 2.1, Hiperface, SSI.

The second channel can be software-selected as an Incremental Output.

Options

Functional Safety
Safe-Torque-Off (STO) and Safe-Brake-Control (SBC) are offered standard.
Optional “Module 3” safety functionality is available, including:
• SS1 – Safe Stop 1
• SS2 – Safe Stop 2
• SOS – Safe Operating Stop
• SLS – Safely-Limited Speed
• SLP – Safely-Limited Position
• SLI – Safely-Limited Increment
• SDI – Safe Direction
• SSM – Safe Speed Monitoring

Related

Applications and How-Tos

Jonathan Bullick | March 8th, 2023

EtherCAT, PROFINET, EtherNet/IP, ModBus TCP, POWERLINK, VARAN

Communication interface

CAN, Diagnostic interface RS485/232, Ethernet

Drive profile

CiA 402 (IEC 61800-7)

Safety profile

Safety over EtherCAT (FSoE), PROFIsafe

Cyclic fieldbus cycle time

EtherCAT up to 250 µs (125 µs on request) PROFINET, EtherNet/IP, ModBus/TCP, POWERLINK, VARAN up to 400 µs

Process data size

EtherCAT up to 32 objects / 64 Byte, PROFINET, EtherNet/IP, ModBus/TCP, POWERLINK, VARAN up to 8 objects / 32 Byte

Fieldbus Ethernet diagnosis

EoE (Ethernet over EtherCAT), PROFINET Ethernet channel, EtherNet/IP Ethernet diagnostic channel, Modbus/TCP Ethernet diagnostic channel

Serial diagnostic interface

DIN 66019 for connection to diagnostic tools (e.g. COMBIVIS) or an operator

Operators / Adapters

LCD operator, Ethernet operator, USB operator, Bluetooth adapter

Tools

COMBIVIS 6, COMBIVIS studio 6, COMBIVIS mobile, COMBIVIS Command Line Interface

body_html:
Servo Drives & VFDs

COMBIVERT H6 Multi-axis Drive

The COMBIVERT H6 is KEB’s multiaxis (shared bus) EtherCAT drive platform. The modular design allows for the addition of power supplies, control units, drive axes, safety options, encoder boards, and communication interfaces.

Catalog Manual Software
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

The COMBIVERT EtherCAT H6 platform uses a shared DC bus connection which allows drive modules to be added as needed. Depending on application requirements – different supply and PLC control units can also be selected.

 

The modules communicate to each other through an EtherCAT bus system. This provides extremely fast and reliable communication while simplifying wiring and reducing installation time. The H6 drive modules are available in single and double-axis outputs. Single-axis modules are available up to 110kW. A modular 6-pulse rectifier supply unit can be supplied to power the drive units through a DC-bus. Alternatively, an Active Front End (AFE) supply unit with filter can be supplied which offers a regulated DC bus and low harmonic performance.

 

For complete machine control, the H6 control unit can be configured as an EtherCAT master. There are also pluggable fieldbus cards which support Profibus, CAN, Interbus, and Profinet The H6 has optional safety modules. Module 1 includes Safe-Torque-Off (STO) and Safe-Brake-Control (SBC) functionality. Module 2 includes: SS1, SS2, SOS, SLS, SLP, SLI, SDI, SSM.

Tech Specs

Electrical

• Power Range (B6 Supply): Up to 225kW

• Power Range (Drive output): Up to 110kW

• Voltage Class: 400V

• Rated Switching Frequency: 8kHz

• Maximum Switching Frequency: 16kHz with derate

Mechanical

• Cooling Type: Fan or Flat Back (Liquid Cooled)

Certifications

• cULus
• CE

Environment

• Protection Rating: IP20
• Rated Altitude: 1000m with derate up to 2000m

Control

• Encoder Feedback: Yes.  Incremental (TTL), Resolver, BiSS, SSI, SinCos, EnDat 2.1/2.2, Hiperface.
• Motor Types: Induction, PM Servo, Torque
• Motor Control: V/Hz, SMM, ASCL, SCL, Closed Loop Vector
• Control Types: Velocity, Torque, Positioning

Options

Supply Unit Three available options:

• B6 bridge rectifier

• Active Front End (AFE)

• 24VDC Control Supply

 

Fieldbus Communication

• EtherCAT master

• EtherCAT slave

• Interbus

• CAN

• Profibus

• Profinet

 

Functional Safety

Type 1:

• STO – Safe-Torque-Off

• SBC – Safe-Brake-Control

Type 2:

• SS1 – Safe Stop 1

• SS2 – Safe Stop 2

• SOS – Safe Operating Stop

• SLS – Safely-Limited Speed

• SLP – Safely-Limited Position

• SLI – Safely-Limited Increment

• SDI – Safe Direction

• SSM – Safe Speed Monitoring

There are also pluggable fieldbus cards which support Profibus, CAN, Interbus, and Profinet The H6 has optional safety modules. Module 1 includes Safe-Torque-Off (STO) and Safe-Brake-Control (SBC) functionality. Module 2 includes: SS1, SS2, SOS, SLS, SLP, SLI, SDI, SSM.
Tech Specs
Electrical
• Power Range (B6 Supply): Up to 225kW
• Power Range (Drive output): Up to 110kW
• Voltage Class: 400V
• Rated Switching Frequency: 8kHz
• Maximum Switching Frequency: 16kHz with derate
Mechanical

Certifications

Environment

• Rated Altitude: 1000m with derate up to 2000m
Control

• Motor Types: Induction, PM Servo, Torque
• Motor Control: V/Hz, SMM, ASCL, SCL, Closed Loop Vector
• Control Types: Velocity, Torque, Positioning
Options
Supply Unit Three available options:
• B6 bridge rectifier
• Active Front End (AFE)
• 24VDC Control Supply
Fieldbus Communication

Functional Safety
Type 1:

• SBC – Safe-Brake-Control
Type 2:
• SS1 – Safe Stop 1
• SS2 – Safe Stop 2
• SOS – Safe Operating Stop
• SLS – Safely-Limited Speed
• SLP – Safely-Limited Position
• SLI – Safely-Limited Increment
• SDI – Safe Direction
• SSM – Safe Speed Monitoring

body_html:
Servo Drives & VFDs

COMBIVERT T6 Auxiliary Inverter

The COMBIVERT T6 is a modular and scalable multi-inverter system, specially designed for auxiliary components in commercial vehicle applications. It can be configured with up to 6 inverter modules, utilizing a mixture of 3 different power module ratings. Multiple integrated units provide significant space, wiring, and cost savings.

Catalog Manual Software
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

Components are automotive qualified in accordance with automotive temperature and vibration standards.

With an IP67, IP6K9K housing, and connectors, the T6 was designed for the harshest environments.

Each inverter axis supports the operation of a variety of motor types, including induction, synchronous PM, switched reluctance, or linear.

KEB’s motor control algorithms allow for closed-loop speed, torque, and positioning performance without the need for encoder feedback (sensorless closed loop).

An embedded main control unit (MCU) supports a CODESYS programming environment for intelligent system control.

With 2 CAN ports available, the MCU also supports a CAN communication gateway with J1939 protocol for easy system integration.

Common-mode DC EMI filters are integrated internally as standard to ensure high operational reliability in electronics systems environments.

 

Tech Specs

Electrical

• Module A: 7.5kW output power, 16.5A output current
• Module B: 15kW output power, 33A output current
• Module C: 30kW output power, 60A output current
• HV DC link rated voltage range: 520 … 750 VDC
• HV DC link input voltage range: 200 … 820 VDC
• Nominal DC Input Current: 120 A
• Maximum DC Input Current (60 sec.): 180 A
• Continuous Electrical Power: 60 kW
• Maximum Electrical Power (60 sec.): 90 kW
• LV DC Voltage Supply Range: 9 … 32 VDC

Mechanical

• Cooling Type: Liquid Cooling
• Coolant: Water-Glycol (50:50)
• Coolant Temperature: 30 … 60 °C
• Coolant Flow Rate: 5 … 15 l/min
• Maximum Coolant System Pressure: 2 bar

Certifications

• Type Approvals: CE, E1
• Protection: ISO20653 6K9K /DIN EN 60529 67
• Climatic Loads: ISO16750-4 Class Z (operation) / Class A (storage and transport)
• Mechanical Loads: ISO16750-3 Code L
• EMC: CE, E1 (ECE R10, CISPR 25)

Complete standards matrix available upon request

Environment

• Enclosure Class: IP67, IP6K9K
• Ambient Conditions: -40 … +85 °C
• Operating Temperature: -30 … +70 °C

Control

• Motor Types: Induction, Synchronous PM, Synchronous Reluctance, Linear
• Motor Control: Sensorless Closed Loop, V/Hz
• Control Types: Velocity, Position

Related

Applications and How-Tos

Auxiliary Inverters for Electric Municipal Vehicles

Tony Heiser | May 1st, 2019
Applications and How-Tos

The Electrification of Agricultural Equipment – Tractor and Implements

Tony Heiser | October 22nd, 2019
Applications and How-Tos

Mining the Benefits with an All-in-One or Multi-Axis Auxiliary Inverter

Tony Heiser | September 10th, 2019
Applications and How-Tos

Auxiliary inverter solutions for fuel cell vehicle turbo compressor applications

Tony Heiser | January 28th, 2019
Applications and How-Tos

EMC Considerations for Auxiliary Inverters in Electric Vehicles Applications

Tony Heiser | September 5th, 2023
KEB Technology

Electrifying Auxiliaries with VFDs in Commercial eMobility applications

Tony Heiser | October 1st, 2018
Applications and How-Tos

How a multi-axis auxiliary inverter solution can benefit your EV design

Tony Heiser | February 13th, 2019

Electrifying Auxiliaries

Aside from the main propulsion motor, electric or hybrid vehicles also include many lower power auxiliaries that can be electrified.

These include power steering pumps, air compressors for air brakes and suspension, HVAC compressors, hydraulic pumps, and coolant pumps.

Designed for Commercial Vehicles

The T6 Auxiliary Inverter is designed to meet the requirements of commercial vehicle applications with the use of automotive-qualified components, E1 markings, CAN J1939 communications, and EMC compliance meeting ECE R10 standards.

Design is in accordance with shock and vibration for commercial vehicles. The production follows automotive industry quality management practices.

Typical vehicle applications include electric buses, heavy-duty trucks, refuse trucks, street sweepers, delivery vans, transport refrigeration, and mobile machinery such as agricultural ePTO implements.

Flexible System Solution

Since commercial vehicles can have multiple auxiliaries, the T6 was designed as a scalable and modular system solution to offer flexibility for a variety of vehicle types and configurations. A system can be scaled from a single inverter output up to six independent motor controllers with modular power rating options for each.

Reduced Components and Cost Benefits
Compared to an individual inverter for each auxiliary, the T6’s scalable multi-axis design can significantly reduce redundant components such as DC cables, DC fuses, low voltage wiring harnesses, and coolant plumbing. Additionally, as the number of inverter outputs of a T6 multi-axis system increases, the cost to add an additional power module continues to go down.

High Performance and Efficient Motor Control

KEB’s motor control algorithms are robust, high-performance, and energy-efficient. The T6 supports all types of AC motors: induction, permanent magnet (servo), and synchronous reluctance.

All motor types can be operated with sensorless control, therefore the need for an encoder or resolver is eliminated…as well as the added costs!

Sensorless motor control also provides highly dynamic speed control and torque accuracy. Closed-loop field-oriented vector control is realized using a software observer model of the motor characteristics with measured motor current and voltage as feedback for internal control loops. Sensorless vector control also operates the motor more efficiently too since the output power is based on the actual load requirements.

Excellent Tools and Support

Setup and integration of the T6 into the vehicle system are simple using KEB’s Combivis 6 programming environment. The program has easy-to-use wizards which guide the user through the start-up process, an automated motor learn function to quickly get motors running with sensorless control, and helpful diagnostics tools such as a digital oscilloscope and a built-in remote-support application.

KEB eMobility application engineers are also available to support customers directly. Regionally distributed in North America and Europe, they offer assistance at every stage of a project, including design concept, system sizing and selection, startup and commissioning, series production preparation, and technical and after-sales troubleshooting and support.

body_html:
EtherCAT C6 Digital I/O

C6 Digital I/O

Offered in various densities and current capacities, KEB’s C6 EtherCAT Digital I/O connects physical sensors to the EtherCAT bus. This advanced system can be optimized for many different industrial applications.

Catalog Installation Manual
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

Status LEDs for Quick Monitoring
The Digital I/O modules feature clear status LEDs that provide instant visual feedback on the operational state of individual digital I/Os. The LEDs enable efficient troubleshooting and diagnostics, enhancing operational efficiency and reducing downtime.

Flexible Voltage Supply
The system supports different terminal voltage supplies, including 24V for digital inputs and outputs, as well as 5V for incremental encoder signals. This flexibility accommodates a range of sensor and actuator configurations, making it adaptable to diverse application requirements.

DI / DO

  • Digital inputs: Up to 32 per module
  • Input delay: 1 ms
  • Signal level: (EN 61131-3, Type 1)
  • Off: -3…5 V
  • On: 15…30 V
  • Digital outputs: Up to 32 per module
  • Mixed DI/DO modules: Yes, available

Tech Specs

Electrical

Max. current: 0.5A and 1.0A outputs available
Total current: max. 8 A
E-Bus load: 135 mA

Mechanical

• DIN Rail Mount (35mm)
• 25x120x90 mm (W x H x D)

Environment

• Operating temperature: 0 … +55 °C
• Storage temperature: -25 … +70 °C
• Relative humidity: 5 … 95 %, without condensation
• IP20

Jonathan Bullick | February 17th, 2023

C6 S14 IPC

Admin | February 25th, 2020

Product Summary

Our C6 EtherCAT Digital I/O system offers a reliable and adaptable solution for incorporating digital signals into the EtherCAT network.

With its status LEDs, flexible voltage support, and comprehensive digital I/O configurations, this system empowers industries to achieve enhanced control, monitoring, and automation.

For more technical details, installation instructions, and application examples, please refer to the product documentation provided by KEB America.

C6 I/O Catalog

Versatile Usage Scenarios

The KEB EtherCAT Digital I/O system finds its application across various industries and automation setups, including:

Industrial Automation: Seamlessly connect physical sensors and actuators to the EtherCAT network, enabling precise control and monitoring of manufacturing processes.

Motion Control: Utilize the incremental encoder signal inputs for accurate position and velocity control in motion systems.

Process Automation: Efficiently integrate digital input signals from different process stages, enhancing overall process automation and data collection.

pro.ProductName: Permanent Magnet Brakes - Power Off - KEB
body_html:
Brakes

Permanent Magnet Brakes

KEB's P1 permanent magnet brakes provide backlash free power-off braking in a very compact package. P1 brakes utilize powerful neodymium permanent magnets which provide excellent torque density. The P1 series has been optimized to provide the highest torque-to-diameter ratio and is ideal for servo motor and robotic joint applications.

Catalog Installation Manual
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

3D Models

Related

Product Details

2nd Generation Design – Best-in-class torque density made possible by using powerful rare earth magnets and optimally designed magnetic layout.

The brake’s small footprint is ideal for robotic arm, medical, and servo motor applications

Designed to operate across a wide temperature range.

Backlash free operation for precision applications – Armature and hub are riveted together

Class F insulation as standard (H is available upon request)

KEB permanent magnet brakes have unlimited ON time and are designed for 100% duty.

Tech Specs

Electrical

• DC Coil Voltage: 12, 24, 48, 105, 205 VCD Standard (Custom upon request)
• Duty: 100% on
• Insulation Class: F is standard (H upon request)

Mechanical

• Type: Permanent magnet set, electrically released
• Torque Range: 0.35 to 130 Nm

Certifications

CSA on Standard product
CE

Environment

• Protection Type: Dry Operation
• Operating Temperature: -15 … 100° C

Options

Connectors
KEB clutches can be supplied with crimped leadwires or with customer-specified connectors.

Flange
Brakes can be supplied with a flange per the customer’s specification.

Hub
P1 brakes can be supplied without a hub, hub to the inside to minimize footprint, or hub to the outside for easier installation.

3D Models

  • Pilot bore shown - contact KEB with questions.
