body_html:
Integral Gearmotors

Helical Bevel Gearmotors

KEB helical bevel geared motors offer compact & efficient power transmission. They are ideal for applications requiring a right angle output. No matter which type of gearing you choose, KEB gearmotors are extremely flexible and customizable and come in many product configurations.

Catalog Selection Software
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

Integral design provides a compact design and lower weight compared to flanged designs

KEB’s high quality 2 and 3-stage helical bevel gearmotors offer 94-96% efficiency

Gearmotors can be supplied with solid output shafts or hollow bores.

KEB gearmotors excel in difficult hoisting and cycling applications

Designed to work with a failsafe spring applied brake. Configure with a hand release, micro switch, or noise dampening.

Helical bevel gearing can be added to a PM servo motor or an induction motor (IE2 & IE3)

Tech Specs

Mechanical

• Output Torque: Up to 15,000Nm
• Brake Option: KEB Spring-set Brake
• Backlash: 10-20 arm/min. as standard. Low backlash option exists

Environment

• Protection Type: IP55 standard. Up to IP65 available.
• Maximum Ambient Temperature: 40° C with possible derate
• Elevation: 1000m rated with possible derate

Options

Spring-set Brakes: Add a spring applied (spring-set) brake to your gearmotor. KEB COMBISTOP Spring Set brakes provide failsafe braking functionality with boosted coils for higher torque and a robust design for tough industrial applications.

KEB brakes provide power-off brake engagement. The brakes used are KEB’s Type 38 brake which includes common options like a manual hand release and micro switch. A quiet brake is available for theatre and stage applications.

Feedback devices
KEB motors can be configured with feedback devices. Common formats include: TTL, HTL, resolver, BiSS, and Hiperface.

Customized outputs
KEB can provide gearmotors with custom flanges or shafts to facilitate mounting to the machine. It is also possible to provide an output flange or shaft on both output sides.

Food Grade Lubricants
For use in food production, KEB gearmotors can be provided with food grade lubricants and greases.

Extra Environmental Protection
For use in washdown or corrosive environments, the gearmotors can be supplied with extra paint protection and seals.

Related

body_html:
EtherCAT I/O

FSoE Safety PLC

KEB's EtherCAT safety PLC is a SIL3/PLe certified safety control that communicates via FSoE (fail-safe over EtherCAT).

Catalog Manual
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

KEB’s SIL3 Safety PLC is a FSoE Master.

KEB’s Safety PLC has been independently certified by TÜV Rheinland to a SIL3/PLe level.

FSoE slaves can be distributed and are connected with standard network cables. This offers the possibility to replace the discrete safety wiring with networked safety.

KEB’s Safe PLC programs in a certified Safety Editor with Function Block Diagram (FBD). The safety programming is done in COMBIVIS Studio 6, allowing complete machine control to be handled in one IDE.

KEB’s Safety PLC communicates via FSoE which is independently SIL3 certified by TÜV SÜD. It can be paired with KEB’s FSoE drives and all safety functions can be handled over the FSoE bus.

Tech Specs

Electrical

Safety Protocol: FSoE
Safety Standard: IEC 61508 SIL3 and DIN EN ISO 13849-1 Ple
Approvals: CE, cULus, TÜV Rheinland
Runtime system: CODESYS RT Safety
Programming Tool: CODESYS Safety integrated from COMBIVIS studio 6 V3.6.60

Mechanical

• DIN Rail Mount (35mm)
• 25x120x90 mm (W x H x D)

Certification

• IEC 61508 SIL3 and DIN EN ISO 13849-1 Ple (TÜV Rheinland)
• CE
• cULus

Environment

• Operating temperature: 0 … +55 °C
• Storage temperature: -25 … +70 °C
• Relative humidity: 5 … 95 %, without condensation
• IP20

pro.ProductName: G6 Open Loop Drive - Products - KEB
body_html:
Servo Drives & VFDs

COMBIVERT G6 Open Loop VFD

The COMBIVERT G6 is a high performance EtherCAT VFD capable of running SENSORLESS CLOSED LOOP (SCL). It includes a dual channel STO as standard. Additional communication (IO Link), EMI filter, and display options are offered.

Catalog Manual Software
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

COMBIVERT G6 communication options include: EtherCAT, VARAN, IO Link, and CANopen

The G6 is offered up to 40 Hp in the 400-480V class. It has a 1-phase, 230V option available to 2Hp

The G6 can be configured with a SIL3-rated dual channel SAFE TORQUE OFF (STO) input.

As standard, the G6 includes an internal braking transistor.

The G6 can operate permanent magnet servo motors without encoder feedback using KEB’s SENSORLESS CLOSED LOOP (SCL™) control.

It is possible to run induction (Asynchronous) motors without feedback using ASCL.

Tech Specs

Electrical

• Power Range: Up to 40HP
• Voltage Classes: 1/230 & 3/480VAC
• Rated Switching Frequency: 4-8kHz
• Maximum Switching Frequency: 8kHz with derate

Mechanical

• Cooling Type: Flat back, Fan, Push Through
• Certifications: cULus, CE

Certification

• cULus
• CE

Environment

• Protection Rating: IP20
• Rated Altitude: 1000m with derate up to 2000m

Control

• Encoder Feedback: No
• Motor Types: Induction, PM Servo, Torque
• Motor Control: V/Hz, SMM™, ASCL™, SCL™
• Control Types: Velocity, Torque

Options

Communication
Optional communication interfaces available are:
• EtherCAT
• IO Link
• VARAN
• CANopen

For applications requiring bus communication, the G6 can be supplied without a screen.
Functional Safety
Dual channel SIL3-rated Safe-Torque-Off (STO) inputs are available as an option.

LCD Keypad
An LCD Keypad can be included with the inverter depending on communication configuration.

An LCD operator can be included on the G6 for diagnostics and parameter adjustment.

pro.ProductName: P6 Pitch Drive - Wind Energy - KEB
body_html:
Drives for Turbine Pitch Control

P6 Pitch Drive

The P6 Pitch Drive is purpose-built to control the blade pitches on wind turbines. The drive series is offered in a variety of different power capacities and are safety certified by TÜV Rheinland to PLd according to EN ISO 13849-1. The drive offers specific features to easily integrate with ultracapacitors/batteries. The drive supports a number of different fieldbus options including EtherCAT and ProfiNet.

For advanced Pitch control the P6 drive can be configured with an internal PLC where functions like Pitch Control Algorithms, State Machines, and component health routines can be implemented. Customers have access to KEB's powerful pre-programmed libraries and the PLC program can be password-secured and encrypted.

Multiple drives can be implemented together for load sharing and redundancy purposes.

Catalog
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

The COMBIVERT P6 was developed specifically for electrical pitch systems, and meets all the requirements for rotary use in the hub of wind power facilities with consideration of prevailing vibration and temperature loads.

In active operation, the electrical system output and speed of the hub are controlled by the rotor blade position. In case of failure of the turbine itself or in the supply network, the pitch inverter fulfils the task of protecting the wind power facility against dangerous over speeds, or brings it to a halt by fast turning of the rotor blades away from the wind.

COMBIVERT P6 is an active part of the wind  turbine safety system, certified by TÜV Rheinland. In safety operation of the entire pitch system, consisting of three COMBIVERT P6, the solution achieves “Performance Level d” according to EN ISO 13849-1. The P6 hence meets the requirements of “GL Guidelines for the certification of wind power facilities (2010)” – a requirement for the European market.

A current unique feature of the COMBIVERT P6 is the high level of integration of the inverter, the loading device for the energy storage system and a fully adequate PLC – all in a highly compact format.
This design means that the P6 is flexible and adaptable to a wide range of customer requirements, without having to provide individual system know-how.

 

Tech Specs

Electrical

  • Connection: 3 phase, 400-480VAC
  • Output Power: 18kW (400V) / 22kW (480V)
  • Nominal Output: 45 A /90 A max. & 52 A/120 A
  • Output Frequency: 0-200 Hz
  • Brake Supply: 24 V
  • EMC filter: C2 rated

Mechanical

• Cooling Type: Through-mount heatsink (Fan cooled)
• Optional: Heating resistors

Control

• Motor Types: Induction, Synchronous PM, DC
• Motor Control: Sensorless Closed Loop, V/Hz
• Control Types: Velocity, Position, Toque

Communication

• EtherCAT
• ProfiNet
• Powerlink
• CANopen
• Interbus
• Profibus

In safety operation of the entire pitch system, consisting of three COMBIVERT P6, the solution achieves “Performance Level d” according to EN ISO 13849-1. The P6 hence meets the requirements of “GL Guidelines for the certification of wind power facilities (2010)” – a requirement for the European market.
A current unique feature of the COMBIVERT P6 is the high level of integration of the inverter, the loading device for the energy storage system and a fully adequate PLC – all in a highly compact format.
This design means that the P6 is flexible and adaptable to a wide range of customer requirements, without having to provide individual system know-how.
Tech Specs
Electrical
Connection: 3 phase, 400-480VAC
Output Power: 18kW (400V) / 22kW (480V)
Nominal Output: 45 A /90 A max. & 52 A/120 A
Output Frequency: 0-200 Hz
Brake Supply: 24 V
EMC filter: C2 rated
Mechanical
• Cooling Type: Through-mount heatsink (Fan cooled)
• Optional: Heating resistors
Control
• Motor Types: Induction, Synchronous PM, DC
• Motor Control: Sensorless Closed Loop, V/Hz
• Control Types: Velocity, Position, Toque
Communication
• EtherCAT
• ProfiNet
• Powerlink
• CANopen
• Interbus
• Profibus

pro.ProductName: Clutch & Brake Rectifier - AC -> DC - KEB
body_html:
COMBITRON

Rectifiers

COMBITRON 91 rectifiers are half-wave or bridge rectifiers that convert AC power to DC power and are used with all types of electromagnetic DC brakes and clutches.

KEB's UL- and CE-certified rectifiers feature interference suppression to limit the interference to class A, in accordance with EN 55011.

Catalog Installation Manual
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

COMBITRON offers a wide range of half-wave and full-wave rectifiers intended for worldwide use. KEB offers rectifiers with ratings up to 720VAC input.

UL Listed

The rectifiers have a robust design and are intended for demanding industrial applications. They contain internal MOVs which protect against voltage peaks of the switching contacts.

The rectifiers are able to switch on either the AC or DC side. DC switching allows for faster response times.

KEB’s rectifIers are extremely compact and can usually be mounted directly in the motor terminal box.
Also, DIN rail mount versions exist for easy panel integration.

They offer a reduced holding voltage option. These switches can be implemented to improve reaction time and reduce power consumption.

KEB offers overexcitation switches which provide a brake or clutch with higher than rated voltage for a small period (~350ms) of time. This shortens the actuation time of the device.

Tech Specs

Electrical

• Voltage Range: Up to 720VAC
• Input Frequency: 50 or 60Hz
• Max. Current Rating: Varies, check individual unit
• Type: Half-Wave, Full-Wave, & Overexcitation
• AC-side Switching: Yes
• DC-side Switching: Yes, on most models

Mechanical

• Housing material: Plastic
• Terminal type: Screw

Certification

• cUL and CE
• UL File #: E308765

Environment

• Rated Operating Temperature: Up to 45° C
• Maximum ambient temperature: 80° C (with derate)

body_html:
Cabinet-built Drive Solutions

Drive Panels

Customizable drive panels and operator stations from KEB are available in drive sizes up to 1000 Hp. Best-practice layout and design allow for error-free operation. The panels can be supplied with a KEB HMI and controls.

Catalog
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

Integrate with other control systems – KEB’s HMI LC supports over 40 communication drivers and is offered with KEB drive panels. The HMI LC handles multiple drives and can act as a communication gateway between protocols used inside the panel and external controls.

Operator stations can be built using touch-screen enabled HMI quick visualization and easy operation.

Mount your KEB industrial Panel PC in a fully enclosed IP65 housing. Various mounting adapters are available including swivel arms. Switches and push buttons can be configured for the application.

The drive panel can be connected to a remote user for secure, off-site maintenance and commissioning. Use KEB’s COMBIVIS Connect software to manage the connection settings and user roles.

Tech Specs

Options

content:
Cabinet-built Drive Solutions
Drive Panels
Customizable drive panels and operator stations from KEB are available in drive sizes up to 1000 Hp. Best-practice layout and design allow for error-free operation.  The panels can be supplied with a KEB HMI and controls.
Catalog
Contact Us
Product Details
Tech Specs
Related
Product Details
Integrate with other control systems – KEB’s HMI LC supports over 40 communication drivers and is offered with KEB drive panels. The HMI LC handles multiple drives and can act as a communication gateway between protocols used inside the panel and external controls.
Operator stations can be built using touch-screen enabled HMI quick visualization and easy operation.
Mount your KEB industrial Panel PC in a fully enclosed IP65 housing. Various mounting adapters are available including swivel arms. Switches and push buttons can be configured for the application.
The drive panel can be connected to a remote user for secure, off-site maintenance and commissioning. Use KEB’s COMBIVIS Connect software to manage the connection settings and user roles.
Tech Specs
Options
Regenerative applications can be supplied with braking resistors or Active-Front-End (AFE) systems. Critical applications can also be supplied with e-stop circuitry and emergency resistors.
Best practice cable layout, filtering, and grounding provide error-free operation. A circuit breaker is used as standard. Additional protection options are available upon request.
UL 1449 4th Edition, type 2 panel surge protection device ensures the circuit breaker will trip, avoiding damage to the drive.
KEB offers drive solutions up to 1000 hp. High frequency motors can be run with KEB’s high speed drives which are capable of up to 16kHz switching frequency. KEB offers both air-cooled and liquid-cooled drives.
KEB offers scalable panel solutions up to 24″. The HMI can act as a PLC gateway to high level controls. Over 40+ drivers are supported, including EtherNET/IP, EtherCAT, Profinet, and Modbus.Panels are built with standard SCCR ratings. Higher SCCR ratings are offered if needed.
As an option, KEB panels can be integrated with control products like KEB’s EtherCAT embedded or industrial PCs and I/O.
KEB offers LCL, Harmonic, EMI, and Sinewave filter options.
The filters meet special application requirements like low harmonics or extremely long motor cable runs.
NEMA 1 / 3 / 4X / 12 options
KEB offers different panel solutions for indoor and outdoor use.

pro.ProductName: VFD Brake Transistor Monitor - Products - KEB
body_html:
VFD Monitoring

Brake Transistor Monitor

VFDs often contain brake transistors which switch on and off to allow excess energy to be shunted across a braking resistor. However, if the brake transistor fails and goes undetected the resistor could see an abnormal amount of current which could lead to failure or even a fire.

KEB's external bake transistor monitor can be added to VFDs in the field. It monitors the status and health of the Brake transistor connected to the AC drive. If the monitor detects a short circuit, it safety disengages the Brake resistor.

Manual
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

The KEB Brake Transistor Monitor is used to check the health of status of a VFD’s brake transistor and resistor circuitry.

Tech Specs

Electrical

• Supply Voltage: 24VDC (18 to 30V)
• Supply Current: 10mA @ 24VDC
• Contact Rating (K1/K2): 2A DC Maximum (30VDC), 2A AC Maxiumum 120VAC
• Monitor Input:

pro.ProductName: R6 Line Regenerative Drive - Products - KEB
body_html:
Regenerative Drives

COMBIVERT R6 Line Regen

KEB R6 regen units use advanced power electronics and a proprietary control algorithm called Natural Current Modulation (NCM) to commutate current back to the grid. When paired with a VFD in overhauling applications, the R6 regen drive replaces traditional braking resistors.

Catalog Manual Software
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

The R6 Regen can be used on both 230 & 480VAC utilities. It auto-detects the line voltage and frequency and makes the appropriate adjustments internally.

R6 units can be used with KEB’s flexible communication operators. EtherNet/IP, ProfiNet, and Modbus are supported.

Replace braking resistors in explosion proof and hazardous locations.

Compact Design – The popular 45kVA unit measures just 5.1 x 11.4 inches (WxH). Units can be paralleled together for added capacity and larger units are available.

KEB’s R6 line regen units contain integrated DC bus fuses and easy-to-wire DC connection terminals.

The R6 units are certified for use worldwide and carry CE, cULus approvals.

Tech Specs

Electrical

• Voltage Class: 230V and 460V
• Rated Frequency: 50/60Hz
• Overload Rating: Typically 150% FLA for 60 seconds
• Rated Power: Graduated offerings up to 330kW

Mechanical

• Cooling type: Air

Certifications

CSA, CE, cULus

Environment

• Protection Type: IP20 standard
• Operating Temperature: -10 … 45° C
• Elevation: 1000m rated; with possible derate to 2000m

Control

• Control Algorithm: KEB NCM

Options

Communication Operators
Modular communication operator can be added.
Most major industrial protocols are offered, including:
• EtherNet/IP
• DeviceNet
• Modbus
• CAN
• Profibus
• EtherCAT
• Powerlink
• Profinet
• Ethernet TCP/IP
• InterBus
• SERCOS

Backmount EMI filter
A backmount EMI filter can be added. This design mounts on the back of the R6 unit and does not increase the footprint dimensions.

Related

Applications and How-Tos

Regen Drives for Cranes and Hoists

Jonathan Bullick | November 6th, 2018
KEB Technology

Is Elevator Line Regeneration Suitable for my Building?

Jonathan Bullick | July 31st, 2017
Applications and How-Tos

Short Circuit Current Rating (SCCR) and Fuse Selection

Tyler Pecha | October 2nd, 2017

body_html:
Filters and Chokes

Line Reactors

KEB line chokes provide input impedance which helps reduce harmonic distortion and increase VFD component lifetimes. KEB load reactors help reduce dV/dT switching peaks and increase motor life.

Catalog
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

Full graduated offering for both 230V and 460V applications.

Improve system performance. Line reactors lower peak charging currents, reduce harmonic distortion, and minimize ripple current on the DC bus.

Load reactors minimize the negative effects of a VFD’s PWM voltage spikes. Ultimately, increasing the motor operating lifetime.

Various impedances offered including 3% and 5%.

Robust overloads for demanding VFD applications.

Tech Specs

Electrical

• Voltage Class: 230V and 480V
• Rated Frequency: 50 and 60Hz versions available
• Overload Rating: 150-200% FLA for 60 seconds
• Impedance: 3% and 5% available

Certifications

• cULus or UL recognized
• CE

Environment

• Protection Type: IP20 standard (IP54 enclosed optional)
• Rated Ambient Temperature: Up to 40° C with possible derate
• Elevation: 2,000 meters with possible derate above

Options

The added impedance improves the drives harmonic current distortion level.

Motor Choke: A motor reactor is placed at the output of a VFD. It reduces the dV/dt levels of the PWM switching and increases motor operating lifetime.

dV/dt Motor Chokes: Specially designed dV/dt motor chokes are available for installations where the motor is mounted a significant distance away from the VFD (> 40 feet).

KEB dV/dt chokes are capable of being used with up to 16kHz switching frequency and have low inductances for use with PM servo motors.

content:
Filters and Chokes
Line Reactors
KEB line chokes provide input impedance which helps reduce harmonic distortion and increase VFD component lifetimes. KEB load reactors help reduce dV/dT switching peaks and increase motor life.
Catalog
Contact Us
Product Details
Tech Specs
Related
Product Details
Full graduated offering for both 230V and 460V applications.
Improve system performance. Line reactors lower peak charging currents, reduce harmonic distortion, and minimize ripple current on the DC bus.
Load reactors minimize the negative effects of a VFD’s PWM voltage spikes. Ultimately, increasing the motor operating lifetime.
Various impedances offered including 3% and 5%.
Robust overloads for demanding VFD applications.
Tech Specs
Electrical
• Voltage Class: 230V and 480V
• Rated Frequency: 50 and 60Hz versions available
• Overload Rating: 150-200% FLA for 60 seconds
• Impedance: 3% and 5% available
Certifications
• cULus or UL recognized
• CE
Environment
• Protection Type: IP20 standard (IP54 enclosed optional)
• Rated Ambient Temperature: Up to 40° C with possible derate
• Elevation: 2,000 meters with possible derate above
Options
Line Choke: A line reactor is placed at the input side of a VFD. The added impedance improves the drives harmonic current distortion level.
Motor Choke: A motor reactor is placed at the output of a VFD. It reduces the dV/dt levels of the PWM switching and increases motor operating lifetime.
dV/dt Motor Chokes: Specially designed dV/dt motor chokes are available for installations where the motor is mounted a significant distance away from the VFD (> 40 feet).
KEB dV/dt chokes are capable of being used with up to 16kHz switching frequency and have low inductances for use with PM servo motors.

pro.ProductName: EtherCAT Encoder Input Module - KEB America Products
body_html:
High Speed Counter

EtherCAT Encoder

KEB's EtherCAT encoder module is used for high-speed inputs.

The C6 EtherCAT counter modules bring incremental encoder signals to the EtherCAT bus. Each module supports 2 TTL quadrature encoder signals with complement tracks and a Z-channel.

Catalog Installation Manual
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

Connect TTL encoders and pulse generators to the EtherCAT bus

Each module supports the connection of 2 Encoders

Inputs support quadrature encoders with compliment signals and a Z-track

An optional analog output provides 12-bit analog feedback

Tech Specs

Electrical

Encoder: 2 A, B, Ref
Encoder type: 5 V (RS422)
Count frequency: max. 400 kHz
Digital inputs: 8
Input delay: 1ms
Signal level: (EN 61131-3, Type 1)
Off: -3…5 V
On: 15…30 V
Digital outputs: 2
Max. current: 2 A per output
E-Bus load: 300 mA

Mechanical

• DIN Rail Mount (35mm)
• 25x120x90 mm (W x H x D)

Environment

• Operating temperature: 0 … +55 °C
• Storage temperature: -25 … +70 °C
• Relative humidity: 5 … 95 %, without condensation
• IP20

Related

Applications and How-Tos

Setup Guide: C6 IO EtherCAT Communication with a Beckhoff PLC

Colin Zauner | March 1st, 2022
KEB Technology

Using the CiA 402 Drive Profile for Motion Control Applications

Jonathan Bullick | December 7th, 2017
Applications and How-Tos

Master-slave drive applications

Jonathan Bullick | June 18th, 2018

Tooth Clutch

KEB's tooth clutch provides 3x more torque than a standard electromagnetic clutch. They can be used in both wet and dry applications and are intended for 0 speed engagement.

Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

More Torque, Less Diameter – 3X more torque than a standard electromagnetic clutch

Zero Backlash design – Great for precision applications

Flexible Voltages – Electrically engaged. KEB can make to customer-specified voltages

Scalable design – Up to 390Nm

Electrical

• DC Coil Voltage: 12, 24, 48, 95, 205VDC are standard (customs available upon request)
• Flying leads standard (connectors available upon request)
• Insulation Class: B is standard (F or H available upon request)
• Duty: Rated 100% on

• Size Range: 21Nm to 390Nm
• Type: Wet and Dry Operation

body_html:
Filters and Chokes

EMI Filters

KEB EMI filters are used with VFDs to reduce the effects of high frequency electrical noise. They help machine builders meet the CE machine directive for filtering. Low leakage filters are available and can be paired together with 3rd-party drive vendors.

Catalog Install Manual
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

The E6 filters are compact book style form and fit conveniently next to the VFD. The E6 filters are available in 8 graduated sizes.

KEB E6 EMI filters are available up to 330A and are rated for installation voltages 0 … 550VAC.

Low Leakage Design – The leakage current of KEB’s E6 filters is only a fraction to that of conventional filters. This allows them to be used with industrial residual-current devices (RCDs)

Using the latest technology filter components and 20+ years of filter design experience, the E6 filters provide excellent performance and comply with EN 61800-3 C1 and C2 environments.

The filters perform well even with long VFD runs and when using high switching frequencies (e.g. 16kHz)

The E6 line of filters can be used as a central filter for multi-axis drive cabinets. This offers the potential for cost savings and improved performance.

Tech Specs

Electrical

• Voltage Class: up to 550VAC
• Rated Frequency: 50 or 60Hz

Environment

• Protection Type: IP20 standard
• Max. operating Temperature: 45° C

Certifications

• UL 508C
• CE

Technical

Performance: • Target frequencies: 0.15 … 30MHz
• Max. leakage current: 30mA
• Compliance: EN 61800-3 C1 & C2

Related

Applications and How-Tos, KEB Technology

7 Steps to Reducing EMI with VFDs

Colin Zauner | July 20th, 2015

body_html:
Clutches

Power On Clutch

COMBINORM electromechanical clutches provide clutch engagement when electrically powered. KEB clutches provide a means to connect primary (driver) and secondary shafts.

Catalog Installation Manual
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

3D Models

Related

Product Details

KEB can install a bearing supported pulley or prepare for customer assembly.

The KEB tooth clutch offers 3x the amount of torque in the same footprint. The tooth clutch can be used in wet and dry applications but requires engagement at zero speed.

KEB’s COMBIBOX product is offered with an enclosed clutch option – the clutch components are protected from contaminants and moisture.

KEB offers special coil voltage, special connector and special design feature.

Tech Specs

Electrical

• DC Coil Voltage: Definable (24V, 105V, & 205V standard)
• Duty: 100% on
• Insulation Class: B (F available as option)

Mechanical

• Size Range: 0.5Nm to 1000Nm
• Type: Dry operation (wet operation for tooth clutch only)
• Mounting Types: Flange, shaft

Certifications

CSA on Standard product

Environment

• Protection Type: IP20 standard (IP44 or IP65 enclosed optional)

Options

KEB offers a number of different clutch options for flange and shaft-mount configurations.

Connectors
KEB clutches can be supplied with crimped leadwires or with customer-specified connectors

Enclosed Version
KEB’s COMBIBOX product can enclose your clutch for higher protection of IP44 (IP65 on request), wash down, or oil tight depending on your applications needs.

3D Models

  • Pilot bore shown - contact KEB with questions

pro.ProductName: Gearboxes for IEC, NEMA and Servo Motors
body_html:
Gearbox Products

Gearboxes

KEB gearboxes can be added to IEC, NEMA and servo motors. The compact gearboxes are offered in offset and right-angle configurations. Different sealing and paint treatments are offered for washdown and outdoor applications.

Catalog Software
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

KEB gearboxes are offered with input options for IEC, NEMA, and servo motors.

Gearing comes in standard or low backlash versions.

Gearboxes are offered in various output configurations including incline, parallel offset, and right angle.

Available as helical bevel, parallel offset, worm, or inline configurations. Units are offered with solid and hollow bore outputs.

Gearmotor housings are made from cast iron to protect the motor from the harshest environments and vibrations.

High quality and efficient helical and bevel gearing utilized in 2-stage and 3-stage designs.

Tech Specs

Electrical

• Voltage class: 230V and 460V standard (others available upon request)
• Rated frequency: 60Hz standard (50Hz available upon request)
• Insulation class: F (inverter ready)
• Duty: S1 continuous (other duties available)
• Motor efficiency: IE2 & IE3 available

Mechanical

• Output torque: Up to 12,300Nm
• Brake option: KEB Spring-set Brake
• Backlash: 10-20 arm/min. as standard. Low backlash option available

Environment

• Protection type: IP55 standard. Up to IP65 available.
• Maximum ambient temperature: 40° C with possible derate
• Elevation: 1000m rated with possible derate

Options

Customized outputs: KEB can provide gearmotors with custom flanges or shafts to facilitate mounting to the machine. It is also possible to provide an output flange or shaft on both output sides.

Food Grade Lubricants: For use in food production, KEB gearmotors can be provided with food grade lubricants and greases.

Extra Environmental Protection: For use in washdown or corrosive environments, the gearmotors can be supplied with extra paint protection and seals.

Related

KEB Technology

Electric Motor Brakes

Jonathan Bullick | October 9th, 2017

Double C Face Brakes

Admin | March 4th, 2020

body_html:
Filters and Chokes

Sine Wave Filters

KEB Sine filters provide a perfect sinusoid waveform to the motor. This reduces motor heating and is advantageous for installations where the drive and motor are separated by extreme distances.

Catalog
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

KEB Sine Filters are low-pass filters that filter out the switching frequency from the pulse width modulation (PWM) from the output of an inverter. The filter then provides a sinusoidal motor current.

When a KEB Sine Filter is used, the allowable motor cable length can be up to 500 meters. The sinusoidal output voltages reduce discharge currents driven by pulse frequency.

The sinusoidal voltage between phases reduces motor noise.

Customers can also expect to see a reduction in high-frequency transient emissions and improve the entire EMC load on the equipment.

Tech Specs

Electrical

• Voltage class: 400V (500V Max)
• Rated current: 1.3-710A
• Max output frequency: options for 100, 200, 800, and 1200/1600 Hz

Environment

• Protection type: IP20
• Climate category: 3K3 (in accordance with EN60721-3-3)

Certifications

• CE
• UL (*Only available on some models. Contact KEB for details.)

Related

Applications and How-Tos, KEB Technology

7 tips for Long Encoder Cable VFD applications

Jonathan Bullick | October 23rd, 2017
KEB Technology

dV/dt Motor Chokes for Long VFD Cable Runs

Jonathan Bullick | September 5th, 2017
KEB Technology

dV/dt filters – FAQ

Jonathan Bullick | August 1st, 2017
Contact Us

Lets Work Together

pro.ProductName: Braking Resistors: High-performance for VFD Applications
body_html:
Braking Resistors for VFD Applications

Braking Resistors

Braking resistors are used to dissipate excess energy in overhauling VFD applications. KEB high-performance resistors are offered in a variety of sizes and configurations along with intrinsically safe types.

Manual Intrinsically Safe Resistors
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

KEB offers several different types of braking resistors in both 230V and 460V classes.

Various design types include backmount, encapsulated, and wirewound brake resistors.

KEB dynamic braking resistors are UL recognized, certifying its design quality.

KEB offers a line of intrinsically safe brake resistors for added protection. The resistors are designed to fail in a safe way instead of catching on fire. These resistors are UL-recognized.

KEB offers drives with back-mounted brake resistors. Panel space is always a premium, allowing for a very compact and small drive footprint.

Tech Specs

Electrical

• Voltage Class – 230 and 400V
• Up to 26kW continuous (440kW 6 second duty)
• Intrinsically Safe – Optional

Mechanical

• Type: Encapsulated and Wire wound
• Protection: IP20 standard (IP60 optional)

Certifications

• CE and UL recognized

Options

Option: Intrinsically Safe Resistors

Related

KEB Technology

VFD regenerative applications

Jonathan Bullick | January 18th, 2016
Applications and How-Tos

3 Ways to Protect a VFD Braking Resistor from Short-Circuit Failure

Mike Keefe | April 10th, 2023
Applications and How-Tos

Brake chopper circuits in VFDs

Brian Holtzkamp | January 22nd, 2018

What are Braking Resistors?

What is it?

Braking resistors are used in VFDs to dissipate unneeded energy produced in the motor, allowing the drive to safely and effectively brake the load. Braking resistors are often the most simple, cost-effective solution in applications requiring fast deceleration.

Braking resistors are essential in operations where the speed of the motor surpasses the speed set by the VFD. These tools support superior braking torque capacity, while keeping bus voltage within the drive’s rated limit. This produces more responsive and reliable braking for even the most demanding industrial applications, preventing overvoltage and damage to the drive.

How Do Braking Resistors Work?

When there is an overhauling load and a drive is used to decelerate the motor, this can create excessive DC bus voltage. If this voltage is not properly controlled and dissipated, it can lead to voltage faults in the drive. Braking resistors for VFD applications can dissipate this excess energy by transforming it into heat over a resistor element.

Correctly sizing a braking resistor is crucial for safe and effective use. Braking resistors for VFD applications require a minimum power rating to stay within acceptable temperature limits during braking operations. Working environment is a vital factor as well, especially in locations with flammable materials (such as sawdust).

Proper installation and testing are important to ensure the braking resistor meets UL standards and to limit the possibility of short-circuit failure. This is why KEB offers intrinsically safe brake resistors, which fail in a safe way to protect the system and avoid costly fires in the event of a short-circuit failure.

Braking Resistors for Industrial Applications

The benefits of braking resistors for VFD systems include safety, efficiency, and dependable performance. Braking resistors provide more precise, controlled braking to prevent hardware damage and nuisance faults in the VFD. These solutions bring several advantages over traditional friction braking, including faster motor braking, reduced component wear, and lower risk of mechanical braking failure. Common applications for braking resistors include elevators, cranes, lifts, and even wind turbines.

For elevator applications, a braking resistor takes on the entire load current, dissipating this power as heat to effectively decelerate the elevator. Speed control is also key for material handling applications, which use braking resistors to ensure smooth operation of cranes and other load-bearing equipment. In the context of wind power, braking resistors for VFD systems absorb excess voltage created by wind turbine motors, creating a braking effect while protecting the electrical drive system by converting this surplus energy into heat.

KEB provides a variety of additional features to support your unique industrial application, including drives with back-mounted brake resistors to minimize drive footprint. We also offer encapsulated and wire-wound braking resistors, which are UL recognized and support system performance through safe, efficient braking. Our team can help you select the ideal braking solution for your application needs and goals.

VFD Braking Resistor Protection
Contact Us

Lets Work Together

Connect with us today to learn more about our industrial automation solutions—and how to commission them for your application.

body_html:
EtherCAT I/O

Stepper Drive

KEB's UL EtherCAT stepper module brings motor control to the DIN rail. The module is state machine compliant to CiA 402 which makes it easy to set up and integrate into an existing system. The module includes inputs for the motor feedback device and other system inputs (e.g. limit switch)

Catalog Installation Manual
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Options

Related

Product Details

Control stepper and BLDC motors with KEB’s Stepper Drive modules

CE and UL listed

Rated up to 5 Amps nominal and 15 Amps peak

Digital I/O included to support limit switches, brake handling and feedback signals

Uses CiA402 motion control profiles

Tech Specs

Electrical

• 12 V .. 72 VDC/cULus: 12V .. 42 VDC motor voltage
• 10 A (stepper) / 15 A (BLDC) peak current
• 5V / 24V incremental emitter
• 5V / 24V hall emitter
• 5 configurable digital inputs (1ms)
• 1 digital output (0.5A)
• CIA402 trigger
• 100 mA e-bus load

Mechanical

• DIN Rail Mount (35mm)
• 25x120x90 mm (W x H x D)

Certifications

  • cULus (up to 42VDC)

Environment

• Operating temperature: 0 … +55 °C
• Storage temperature: -25 … +70 °C
• Relative humidity: 5 … 95 %, without condensation
• IP20

Motor Modes

• Stepper motor in open loop mode
• Stepper motor in closed loop mode
• Brushless DC motor

Drive Modes

• Stepper motor in open loop mode
• Stepper motor in closed loop mode
• Brushless DC motor

Options

• Stepper motor in open loop mode
• Stepper motor in closed loop mode
• Brushless DC motor

body_html:
Software

COMBIVIS Studio 6

COMBIVIS Studio 6, the automation and drive configuration software, provides a powerful all-in-one environment for programming KEB drives, controls, and I/O.

Studio 6 supports all IEC 61131-3 languages like Ladder Diagram and Structured Text. KEB’s extensive function block libraries, motion profile editors, and simulation tools simplify complex machine routines and shorten development timelines. Production code can be encrypted and secured.

Catalog Download Software
Contact Us

Product Details

Tutorials

Related

Product Details

COMBIVIS Studio 6 supports all 6 IEC 61131-3 programming languages including Ladder Diagram (LD), Structured Text (ST), and Function Block Diagram (FBD).

Reduce traditional development times by up to 60%. Studio 6 includes KEB’s powerful libraries which facilitate EtherCAT drive communication, Master-Follower synchronization, and Camming profiles.

Users benefit from comfortable “SmartCoding” with tools for declaration, error diagnosis, debugging and online data analysis.

Intuitive start-up assistants, digital 16-channel oscilloscope, tools for data backup and recovery, and extensive expert tweaks for optimised fine tuning of systems, complete the engineering software from the development of automation to after-sales service.

Protect your proprietary code by encrypting source code

Tutorials

1. Cables to Connect

This video will step you through the types of cables you can use to connect a KEB device to COMBIVIS 6 software.

Studio 6 supports all IEC 61131-3 languages like Ladder Diagram and Structured Text. KEB’s extensive function block libraries, motion profile editors, and simulation tools simplify complex machine routines and shorten development timelines. Production code can be encrypted and secured.

COMBIVIS Studio 6 supports all 6 IEC 61131-3 programming languages including Ladder Diagram (LD), Structured Text (ST), and Function Block Diagram (FBD).
Reduce traditional development times by up to 60%. Studio 6 includes KEB’s powerful libraries which facilitate EtherCAT drive communication, Master-Follower synchronization, and Camming profiles.
Users benefit from comfortable “SmartCoding” with tools for declaration, error diagnosis, debugging and online data analysis.
Intuitive start-up assistants, digital 16-channel oscilloscope, tools for data backup and recovery, and extensive expert tweaks for optimised fine tuning of systems, complete the engineering software from the development of automation to after-sales service.
Protect your proprietary code by encrypting source code
Tutorials
1. Cables to Connect
This video will step you through the types of cables you can use to connect a KEB device to COMBIVIS 6 software.
2. Connecting a device to a New Project
This video shows how to connect a KEB F5 VFD, inverter or other device to Combivis 6 automation software.
3. Navigation and Editing Parameter Values
See how to navigate Combivis 6 automation software after connecting to a KEB F5 device and how to set parameters with the inverter or keypad operator. This video uses a KEB F5 VFD, but the steps also apply to other devices.
4. Saving Projects and Parameter Lists
This Combivis 6 automation software tutorial shows how to save projects and create parameter lists.
5. Setting Up and Saving Online Scopes
This video shows you how to create and save online scopes in KEB’s Combivis 6 automation software. This is part of a video tutorial series from KEB America designed educate users on the basics of Combivis 6.
6a. How to Download Parameters to KEB device
Using KEB Combivis 6 software you can program a VFD from a saved file on your computer. Before you download parameters to the drive make sure the drive is disabled and there are no active inputs. Find the previously saved parameter list and go through the steps to download it to the drive. If the parameter download is successful and there are no errors you can proceed to enable the drive and use the system as designed.
6b. How to Upload Parameters from a KEB Device to COMBIVIS 6
This is how to save parameters from a KEB device to a file on your computer. Using KEB Combivis 6 software you can upload a VFD parameter list to your computer.

body_html:
Software

COMBIVIS HMI

COMBIVIS Studio HMI is used to program KEB’s HMI products. Studio HMI features built-in features like dataloggers, recipes, and alarm handling. Projects can be easily scaled up and down depending on the HMI screen size. The HMI and Software support over 40 drivers including EtherNet/IP and can be used with 3rd party PLC platforms.

Catalog Download Software
Contact Us

Product Details

Tutorials

Related

Product Details

Create HMI projects. Sync projects in Studio 6 for seamless integration.

40+ drivers which allow KEB HMIs to be used with Allen-Bradley, Siemens, and Schneider PLCs.

Advanced Runtime supports Datalogging (between 1024-4096 tags). Much more economical than other historian platforms.

Enable SMS texts and e-mail alerts.

Advanced Recipe handling and Alarm Management

COMBIVIS HMI product Introduction:

COMBIVIS HMI product Introduction:
COMBIVIS HMI product environment overview:
Tutorials
1. Getting Started - How to Create a Project
The document below explains how to create a COMBIVIS Studio HMI project using the “New Project Wizard.” Tap the link below to download the PDF that will take you through the steps to get started with our KEB HMI software.
KEB HMI Software Create Project Tutorial PDF
2. Working with Screens
This document explains how to perform basic screen navigation in a Studio HMI project. The following sections will describe the tasks of (1) changing screens, (2) using popup screens, (3) using embedded screens, and (4) setting a startup screen.
Working with Screens Tutorial PDF
Working With Screens COMBIVIS HMI Project Zip File
3. Configuring Alarms
This document explains how to create alarms in an HMI project. Alarms are useful for displaying critical machine and safety information to the operator. In addition, the alarm dispatcher may be used to send SMS and email alerts to those impacted by the alarm condition.
Configuring Alarms Tutorial PDF
HMI – Alarms project Zip File
4. Recipes
This document explains how to define and manage recipes in an HMI project. Recipes allow operators to easily switch between sets of parameter values during runtime. This is especially useful for changing machine parameters within a production process.
Working with Recipes Tutorial PDF
Working With Recipes Project Zip File
5. Parameterized Screens Using Alias Variables
This document overviews how to parameterize a screen. Parameterized screens are useful in cases where there are similar data sets that should be displayed and/or edited in a visualization. Rather than creating a screen for each data set, a single screen may be parameterized to display any of the similar data sets. This saves development time, and project memory size, and allows for a cleaner project.
Parameterized Screens
Tutorial PDF
Parameterized Screens Project Zip File
6. Dynamic Text Using the String Table
This document explains how to use the String Table feature of Studio HMI to display dynamic text, and active screen information, and define multiple languages for the user interface.
String Table
Tutorial PDF
String Table Project Zip File
7. Users and User Groups
This document explains how to create users and user groups and control their access to an HMI project.
User and User Groups
Tutorial PDF
User and User Groups Project Zip File
8. Communication Setup Between KEB PLC and HMI
See how to exchange variables between COMBIVIS Studio 6 and Studio HMI through the Symbol Configuration. This allows read/write operations between a PLC and HMI visualization, giving the HMI users the ability to view tag values as well as edit them if desired.
HMI – PLC Communication Tutorial PDF
HMI – PLC Communication project Zip File
9. How to Upload, Download, and Delete HMI Projects
This document explains how to upload, download, and delete COMBIVI Studio HMI projects on KEB devices.
Project Upload Download Delete Tutorial PDF
Allen Bradley Micro800 Communication Setup and Tag Import
This is how to set up an Allen Bradley Micro800 Ethernet/IP communication driver and import tags from a Rockwell Automation Connected Component Workbench (CCW) project.
AB PLC and KEB HMI Tutorial PDF
AB PLC project Zip File
KEB HMI project Zip File
Allen Bradley Ethernet/IP Communication Setup and Tag Import
This document explains how to set up an Allen Bradley Ethernet/IP communication driver
and import tags from a Rockwell Automation Logix 5000 project.
Allen Bradley Ethernet/IP Setup PDF
AB Ethernet/IP Communication Solution Zip File
Siemens TIA Communication Setup and Tag Import
This is how to configure communication between a Siemens S7-1200
PLC and a KEB HMI product using both Profinet and TCP/IP.
Siemens PLC and KEB HMI Tutorial PDF
TCP Solution Zip File
Profinet Solution  Zip File

body_html:
EtherCAT Module

EtherCAT Multi-Fieldbus Interface (MFI)

As an advanced solution, KEB's EtherCAT Multi-Fieldbus Interface (MFI) connects EtherCAT Digital IO to other industrial communication protocols. The EtherCAT MFI module supports connection to ProfiNet, Powerlink, and EtherNet/IP networks, enabling streamlined data exchange and enhanced connectivity.

Catalog Installation Manual
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

The EtherCAT Multi-Fieldbus Interface serves as a pivotal gateway between EtherCAT I/O and other fieldbus systems. This advanced slave device enables users to establish a bridge between EtherCAT and a secondary fieldbus interface, making cross-communication between industrial protocols straightforward.

Fieldbus Diversity: The MFI is available in three versatile variants: EtherNet/IP adapter, ProfiNet I/O device, and Powerlink slave. This comprehensive compatibility allows users to interconnect various fieldbus networks effortlessly.

Seamless Data Exchange: Users can exchange up to 300 bytes of process data per scan between two fieldbus networks. This high data throughput facilitates efficient and real-time information sharing between different parts of a production process.

Comprehensive Compatibility: The MFI collaborates seamlessly with KEB’s entire range of I/O modules, encompassing digital, analog, relay, counter, safety, and stepper motor control modules. This ensures that the MFI easily integrates into various industrial setups.

Precision Synchronization: The MFI employs the EtherCAT protocol, renowned for its precision synchronization capabilities. This enables synchronized data exchange and position measurements with high accuracy, crucial for applications demanding precision and synchronization.

Robust Industrial Ethernet: Supporting EtherCAT and other protocols like ProfiNet, EtherNet/IP, and Powerlink, the MFI leverages the power of industrial Ethernet to provide reliable and efficient communication in demanding industrial environments.

Compact and Versatile Design: The MFI boasts a compact design, fitting seamlessly into industrial setups. Its DIN rail mountable form factor (35mm) and dimensions (25x120x90 mm W x H x D) ensure easy integration into existing systems.

content:
EtherCAT Module
EtherCAT Multi-Fieldbus Interface (MFI)
As an advanced solution, KEB's EtherCAT Multi-Fieldbus Interface (MFI) connects EtherCAT Digital IO to other industrial communication protocols. The EtherCAT MFI module supports connection to ProfiNet, Powerlink, and EtherNet/IP networks, enabling streamlined data exchange and enhanced connectivity.
Catalog
Installation Manual
Contact Us
Product Details
Tech Specs
Related
Product Details
The EtherCAT Multi-Fieldbus Interface serves as a pivotal gateway between EtherCAT I/O and other fieldbus systems. This advanced slave device enables users to establish a bridge between EtherCAT and a secondary fieldbus interface, making cross-communication between industrial protocols straightforward.
Fieldbus Diversity:
The MFI is available in three versatile variants: EtherNet/IP adapter, ProfiNet I/O device, and Powerlink slave. This comprehensive compatibility allows users to interconnect various fieldbus networks effortlessly.
Seamless Data Exchange:
Users can exchange up to 300 bytes of process data per scan between two fieldbus networks. This high data throughput facilitates efficient and real-time information sharing between different parts of a production process.
Comprehensive Compatibility:
The MFI collaborates seamlessly with KEB’s entire range of I/O modules, encompassing digital, analog, relay, counter, safety, and stepper motor control modules. This ensures that the MFI easily integrates into various industrial setups.
Precision Synchronization:
The MFI employs the EtherCAT protocol, renowned for its precision synchronization capabilities. This enables synchronized data exchange and position measurements with high accuracy, crucial for applications demanding precision and synchronization.
Robust Industrial Ethernet:
Supporting EtherCAT and other protocols like ProfiNet, EtherNet/IP, and Powerlink, the MFI leverages the power of industrial Ethernet to provide reliable and efficient communication in demanding industrial environments.
Compact and Versatile Design:
The MFI boasts a compact design, fitting seamlessly into industrial setups. Its DIN rail mountable form factor (35mm) and dimensions (25x120x90 mm W x H x D) ensure easy integration into existing systems.

body_html:
Software

COMBIVIS Connect

KEB's CONNECT infrastructure allows remote maintenance of machines from anywhere in the world via secure End-to-End connections. CONNECT offers advanced user/group management with configurable firewall settings. CONNECT also has an audit log for user traceability.

Catalog Download Software
Contact Us

Product Details

Tutorials

Related

Product Details

SECURITY CERTIFICATE
COMBIVIS CONNECT™ is certified according to the industrial communication network security standards IEC 62443. This certification was awarded due to the successful audit carried out by the independent organization ProtectEM.

VPN CONNECTIONS
Secure data transmission with end-to-end VPN connections. VPN connections use TLS/SSL protocols and AES and RSA encryption.

WORLDWIDE SERVER INFRASTRUCTURE
Reliable and redundant worldwide servers that guarantee quality connections with maximum data protection regardless of installation location.

Customers can manage an unlimited number of users and devices on their CONNECT™ Domain account without hidden or recurring costs.

USER MANAGEMENT
Users and user groups can be created and organized easily with different access rules.
Only authorized users have access to remote devices.

CUSTOM FIREWALL PROPERTIES
Custom firewall policies can be created based on MAC address, IP address, or communication protocol.

AUDIT FEATURE
Records and saves all remote access activities.
This includes a full overview of who and how long each user has been connected.

FILE EXCHANGE WITH REMOTE DEVICES
Download and upload files from connected devices.

API INTERFACE
The Control Center API allows for integration with external software applications.
For example, devices can be logged into automatically at a scheduled time for data file retrieval.

CONTROL CENTER FEATURES
• Security Certified – IEC 62443-3
• Secure end to end VPN connections
• SSL/TLS protocol, encryption and certificates
• Simple Setup and fast device configuration
• Firewall and IT-friendly
• Audit of all Domain activities
• Structured Organization with Domain account
• User and Device Management
• Device Access Profiles
• Custom Firewall Policies for VPN traffic
• Secure File Transfer

COMBIVIS CONNECT RUNTIME FEATURES
• VPN to a remote system (Ethernet and Serial)
• Integrated Firewall
• API for interface with in-house software applications
• Runtime Operations Log
• Support for automatic firmware updates
• Remote Desktop, File and Task management, chat, screenshot
• Supports multiple connections
• Fast USB Configuration
• WAN to LAN routing tables

Tutorials

1. Add a C6 Smart or HMI to Domain

This document explains how to connect both a C6 Smart and an HMI device to the COMBIVIS Connect network and register it to a domain.

  • Add C6 Smart and HMI to COMBIVIS Connect network Tutorial PDF

2. MQTT Cloud Router with Microsoft Azure

This document explains how to push data via MQTT to Microsoft Azure and store it in a database using a KEB cloud router.

  • MQTT Cloud Router and Azure Tutorial PDF
  • MQTT and Azure Project File
  • Function App Code txt file

3. MQTT Cloud Router with AWS

This document explains how to push data via MQTT to AWS (Amazon Web Services) and store it in a database using a KEB cloud router.

  • MQTT Cloud Router and AWS Tutorial PDF
  • MQTT and AWS Project File
  • Lambda Script Zip File

pro.ProductName: Harmonic Filter - KEB's High Performance Z1 Harmonic Filters
body_html:
Filters and Chokes

Harmonic Filter

The KEB Z1 harmonic filter allows users to comply with IEEE 519 power quality standards by reducing VFD distortion. Discover its unique design, features, performance, and sizes below.

Catalog Manual (Filter only) Manual (w/NEMA 1 Enclosure)
Contact Us

Product Details

Related

Product Details

The KEB harmonic filters reduce harmonic distortion and its adverse effects. These filters can achieve sub-8% THiD levels.

Features include:
● High-performance electrical grade steel provides 99% efficiency.
● With its passive design, no extra circuitry or controls are required. It can be easily added to existing installations.
● CE and UL listed.
● Graduated sizes are available and can be economically matched to each application.

Both 50Hz and 60Hz filter designs are available depending on the installation power.

Related

News, Technical Papers

Elevator Drive Harmonics Q & A with KEB

Jonathan Bullick | July 24th, 2023
KEB Technology

Elevator Regenerative Drives – How They Work

Jonathan Bullick | August 18th, 2017
KEB Technology

Harmonic Filters for Reducing VFD Distortion

Jake Wattenphul | April 11th, 2023

Unique Harmonic Filter Design

The KEB harmonic filters utilize a patented design incorporating the inductor windings on a common core. This common core design provides the following advantages over competitor harmonic filters:

● High damping of mainline voltage overshoot
● Minimal oscillations due to rapid load changes
● Increased lifetime of intermediate DC bus capacitors due to the trapezoidal output of the voltage waveform (less DC bus ripple)
● Negligible DC bus voltage drop at full load
● Parallel operation of several VFDs from a single harmonic filter
● Low capacitive reactive power at idle or low loads

UL Rated Harmonic Filter Sizes

KEB harmonic filters utilize three-phase capacitors in a delta configuration. The three-phase capacitor design increases the symmetry and helps to protect the VFD from voltage surges in the event of a phase failure.

All three phases are disconnected simultaneously in the event of a capacitor failure. A phase failure on a competitor’s harmonic filters using single-phase capacitors can result in a severe voltage imbalance and cause damage to the VFD input stage.

● KEB harmonic filters are available specifically for applications with 480VAC, 60hz mains, or 400VAC (380), 50Hz mains.
● KEB harmonic filters are UL rated and available in sizes ranging from 23A to 400Amp rated input current.
● All KEB harmonic filters incorporate a circuit protection device on the capacitor banks of the harmonic filter. The capacitor banks are mounted independently of the inductor core assembly to allow for increased mounting flexibility.
● Capacitor contactor option available to disconnect the capacitor bank when the machine is idle.
● KEB harmonic filters utilize lug-style power connections and can be equipped with a line sync module for use with the KEB R6 line regenerative unit.

KEB Harmonic Filters Performance

KEB has developed a line of harmonic filters designed to be used on the input of a 6-pulse full-wave rectifier. The standard KEB harmonic filter line is designed to reduce the total harmonic distortion (THD) of both current and voltage on the main input line to a maximum of 8%. This level is valid for an Isc /IL ≥ 20.

As an example of the effectiveness of the KEB harmonic filter, the following waveforms show the advantages of using a KEB harmonic filter.

 

Voltage and current at the mainline – no line choke

 

Without a line choke, high current peaks (5 to 10 times the RMS value) occur, resulting in a high ripple current in the DC bus of the motor control. This also means higher ripple voltage on the DC bus which can lead to torque ripple or reduced torque output from the motor.

Voltage and current with line choke impedance = 3% 480V/60Hz (4% 400V/50Hz)

 

With inductance (line choke), the peak amplitude of the current is reduced to a range of 3 to 5 times the RMS value. This means a lower ripple current in the DC bus of the motor control. This reduces heating in the capacitors and effectively extends the lifetime by a factor of two.

Voltage and current with the harmonic filter THDI < 8%

 

With the harmonic filter, the line-side current is sinusoidal.

The peak amplitude of the current is 1.4 times the RMS value. The filter output provides a nearly ideal rectangular voltage and current waveform into the motor control resulting in diode conduction of almost 180 degrees.

The voltage on the DC bus is practically flat, and the DC bus capacitors see minimum ripple current, resulting in a further extension of life to 3+ times the nominal.

Furthermore, the average voltage value of the DC bus does not sag much compared to the first two cases. The result is more motor torque at higher speeds.

pro.ProductName: dV/dt Filters - Motor Chokes - Products - KEB
body_html:
Filters and Chokes

dV/dt Filters - Motor Chokes

KEB dV/dt filters reduce the peak voltage levels seen by the motor in VFD applications. dV/dt chokes help protect the motor insulation and increase operating lifetime by reducing motor heating.

Catalog
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

KEB’s dV/dt chokes do not skew the VFD’s motor model or negatively affect motor performance. They can be used with either PM or Induction Motors.

KEB dV/dt filters can be operated safely and effectively with high output frequencies from the drive – up to 16kHz carrier frequency.

Our dV/dt motor chokes have the secondary benefit of reducing EMI emissions (>250kHz range) from the VFD output.

Tech Specs

Electrical

• Voltage class: 230 &480V
• Rated current: 22-100A in graduated sizes
• Max switching frequency: 16kHz

Certifications

• CE
• UL

Environment

• Protection type: IP20
• Climate category: 3K3 (in accordance with EN60721-3-3)

Related

KEB Technology

body_html:
EtherCAT I/O

Temperature Inputs

KEB's C6 EtherCAT temperature modules bring physical temperature sensor data to the EtherCAT bus. Our modules support type J, K, and mV thermocouples, Pt100/Ni100, and Pt1000/Ni1000 sensor types.

Catalog Installation Manual
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

One KEB EtherCAT temperature module supports many different sensor types including Thermocouples, PT and Ni probes.

Tech Specs

Electrical

AI4/8-PT/NI/ THERMO
Analog inputs: 4 or 8
Resolution: 16 Bit
Conversion time: 50ms (adjustable)
E-Bus load: 170 mA

Thermoelement
Sensor type: J,K, mV (internal)
Cold point compensation: yes
Measuring range: Typ K -200 °C…+1372 °C
Measuring range: Typ J -50 °C…+760 °C
Measuring range: mV -40 … +65 mV
Pt100 / Ni100
Measuring range: Pt -75 °C…+670 °C
Measuring range: Ni -60 °C…+250 °C
Input resistance:70…320 Ω
Measuring current:1 mA (typical)
Pt1000 / Ni1000
Measuring range: Pt -75 °C…+670 °C
Measuring range: Ni -60 °C…+250 °C
Input resistance: 700…3200 Ω
Measuring current: 0.1 mA (typical)

Mechanical

• DIN Rail Mount (35mm)
• 25x120x90 mm (W x H x D)

Environment

• Operating temperature: 0 … +55 °C
• Storage temperature: -25 … +70 °C
• Relative humidity: 5 … 95 %, without condensation
• IP20

body_html:
HMIs

C6 S14 IPC

The C6 S14 IPC is a complete machine controller that is capable of real-time motion control. The S14 offers brilliant visualization with both resistive and capacitive touch options.

Catalog Installation Manual
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

The S14 is a PLC+HMI combo that is ideal for medium-high performance machines.

The S14 boasts an ARM Cortex A9 processor and EtherCAT master that allows for coordinated motion control.

The displays are offered in both 4:3 and 16:9 formats in graduated sizes up to 15.6”. Both resistive and capacitive touch technology is available.

A Micro UPS is included for the backup of critical parameters and programs in the event of a power loss.

KEB’s CONNECT secure remote access platform is included with the device.

Tech Specs

Electrical

• CPU: ARM Cortex A9 i.MX6 DualLite @ 1 GHz
• System Memory: 1GB DDR3-800
• Input Voltage: 18 – 36 VDC incl. micro UPS (First charge in 30s, recharge in 15s)
• Operating System: Windows Embedded Compact 7 Pro
• HMI: COMBIVIS Studio HMI runtime
• Remote Control: COMBIVIS Connect™
• Mass Memory: eMMC (Solid State Disk). 4 GB for operating system and runtime environments (internal, not removable)
• Application memory: 8 GB project memory for further free use
• Retain memory: 128 KB persistent and retain

Mechanical

• Sizes: 7.0″ – 15.6″
• Front Panel: Aluminum, Polycarbonate IP66K protection
• Touch Tecnology: Capacitive and Resistive (4 or 5-wire resistive)

Certifications

• CE
• cULus LISTED

Interfaces

• 1xRS232/422/485 (DB15M)
• 2×10/100/1000 Mbps (RJ45)
• 2xUSB 2.0
• SD/SDHC card slot
• CAN (optional)

Environment

• Operating Temperature: 0 … 50 °C
• Storage Temperature: -20 … 60 °C
• Humidity: 95% max (non-condensing)

body_html:
HMIs

C6 HMI LC

Based on KEB’s HMI line, the LC version adds an EtherCAT master and COMBIVIS RTE. This makes the HMI LC perfect for entry-level machines requiring a display and basic PAC functionality. The C6 HMI LC is the perfect all-in-one solution. The HMI is also available in a stainless steel version.

Catalog Installation Manual
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

The HMI LC is a PLC+HMI combo that is ideal for handling the logic and visualization for industrial machines.

The HMI LC is offered in sizes from 5.7″ up to 15.6″. A variety of display formats is also available including 4:3, 15:9, 16:9, and 16:10.

C6 HMIs provide responsive high-resolution graphics. They boast 16 million colors, are brightly backlit, viewable from wide angles, and can auto-adjust to the customer’s screen size.

The HMI LC is equipped with an EtherCAT master and COMBIVIS RTE. This makes the HMI LC perfect for entry-level machines requiring a display and basic PAC functionality.

The HMI LC uses the Windows Embedded Compact Pro 7 providing a solid and reliable OS. Additionally, Visual Basic, Excel, and other programs run in this familiar environment.

Each KEB HMI ships with COMBIVIS CONNECT, which allows the HMI to be securely and remotely connected. This opens up the possibility for offsite commissioning and remote support and maintenance.

With over 40 supported drivers, KEB HMIs speak your language. Supported protocols include EtherNet/IP, Profinet, EtherCAT, MODBUS, and many more.

Tech Specs

Electrical

• CPU: ARM Cortex A8 processor Freescale i.MX535 1GHz 400 MHz memory bus
• System Memory: 1GB DDR3-800
• Input Voltage: 18 – 36 VDC
• Operating System: Windows Embedded Compact 7 Pro
• HMI: COMBIVIS Studio HMI runtime
• Remote Control: COMBIVIS Connect
• Mass Memory: NAND Flash, 256 MB for operating system and runtime environments (internal, not removable).
• Mass Memory: eMMC (Solid State Disk). 4 GB project memory for free use.

Mechanical

• Sizes: 5.7″ – 15.6″
• Front Panel: Aluminum, Polycarbonate IP66K protection
• Touch Tecnology: 4 or 5-wire resistive, dependent on screen size

Certifications

• cULus Listed (508A)
• UL File no.: E356364
• CE (EN 55022, EN 61000-3-2/3, EN 55024, EN 60950-1)

Interfaces

• 1xRS232/422/485 (DB15M)
• 2×10/100 Mbps (RJ45)
• 2xUSB 2.0
• SD/SDHC card slot

Environment

• Operating Temperature: 0 … 50 °C
• Storage Temperature: -20 … 60 °C
• Humidity: 80% max (non-condensing)

Related

body_html:
HMIs

C6 HMI Panels

KEB C6 HMIs are designed for the toughest industrial environments and support 40+ communication drivers. They ship standard with KEB Connect™, our remote connection software which allows the HMI to be securely and remotely connected. This opens up the possibility of offsite commissioning and remote support.

Catalog Installation Manual 3D Model Downloads
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

Related

Product Details

KEB HMIs are offered in sizes from 4.3″ up to 15.6″. Both traditional (4:3) and widescreen (16:9) options are available. By design, they do not contain fans or hard drives. Chipsets and components are selected to provide years of longevity and support.

C6 HMIs provide responsive high-resolution graphics. They boast 16 million colors, are brightly backlit, viewable from wide angles, and can auto-adjust to the customer’s screen size.

KEB HMIs use the Windows Compact Embedded 7 OS providing a solid and reliable OS. Additionally, visual basic, excel, and other programs run in this familiar environment.

KEB HMIs speak your language. Over 40 drivers are available to connect with nearly all major PLC vendors.

Built-in CONNECT secure remote access included.

Tech Specs

Electrical

• CPU: ARM Cortex A8 processor Freescale i.MX535 1GHz 400 MHz memory bus
• System Memory: 1GB DDR3-800
• Input Voltage: 18 – 36 VDC
• Operating System: Windows Embedded Compact 7 Pro
• HMI: COMBIVIS Studio HMI runtime
• Remote Control: COMBIVIS Connect™
• Mass Memory: NAND Flash, 256 MB for operating system and runtime environments (internal, not removable).
• Mass Memory: eMMC (Solid State Disk). 4 GB project memory for free use.

Mechanical

• Sizes: 4.3″ – 15″
• Front Panel: Aluminum, Polycarbonate IP66k protected
• Touch Tecnology: 4 or 5-wire resistive, dependent on screen size

Certifications

• cULus Listed (508A)
• UL File no.: E356364
• CE (EN 55022, EN 61000-3-2/3, EN 55024, EN 60950-1)

Interfaces

• 1xRS232/422/485 (DB15M)
• 2×10/100 Mbps (RJ45)
• 2xUSB 2.0
• SD/SDHC card slot

Environment

• Operating Temperature: 0 … 50 °C
• Storage Temperature: -20 … 60 °C
• Humidity: 80% max (non-condensing)

Related

body_html:
Brakes

Power On Brakes

COMBINORM electromagnetic brakes provide power-on brake engagement. They provide a cost effective option to stop and hold a shaft in place.

Catalog Installation Manual
Contact Us

Product Details

Tech Specs

3D Models

Related

Product Details

KEB’s COMBINORM brakes are electrically engaged.

KEB’s COMBINORM power-on brakes are electrically engaged

They feature a simple proven design with few moving parts – this leads to long operating lifetimes.

When the brake is open there is no torque drag. This equates to less heating and longer brake lifetimes.

Brake coils can be wound for whatever the application requires. 12, 24, 48, 95, and 205VDC coils are standard.

KEB’s power on brakes are offered in either flange or shaft mount designs.

The armature, flatspring, and hub have a riveted connection – providing high accuracy starting and stopping.

Tech Specs

Electrical

• DC Coil Voltage: 12, 24, 48, 95, 205VDC are standard (customs available upon request)
• Flying leads standard (connectors available upon request)
• Insulation Class: B is standard (F or H available upon request)
• Duty: Rated 100% on

Mechanical

• Type: Electrically Engaged
• Maximum Speed: 2,000 – 10,000 rpm
• Torque Range: 0.5 – 500 Nm

Certifications

CSA on Standard product

Environment

• Protection Type: Dry Operation
• Environmental Rating: IP20

3D Models

  • Pilot bore shown - contact KEB with questions
  • This field is for validation purposes and should be left unchanged.
